Reviews.Title: “Good things in small packages”
Reviews.Author: runsforthetrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the single "cabins" for two nights. The room was very small but well-designed and quiet. A shared bathroom was just down the hall and always very clean. The showers were large with dinner plate sized shower heads and good water pressure (4th floor). The staff was very professional and friendly. The location between the West Village and the Meatpacking district is excellent, just south of the Highline but a bit of a walk from the subway lines. If you stay here, have dinner at Barbuto around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “somehow different”
Reviews.Author: mauhey
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in Chelsea. The room where I stayed was really tiny, looked like a boat room. Still it was confortable. Free WiFi. No breakfast. Luggage storage service. Shared bathrooms/showers were clean and "unisex". The price is good for New York standards, expansive if you think about what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny-tiny but cute”
Reviews.Author: blondny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jane on a Friday and Saturday night with a friend while visiting NYC. The room is like, the smallest room I have ever stayed in. Also there is this funny thing where the lights will only work when you still this metal rod in a hole in the wall. But the bed was comfy and I was not disturbed by noise, which was my biggest concern. I didn't like the bathroom situation though. My section which probably had 20-30 rooms only had ONE bathroom, which was coed. So basically I would be shaving, while some German girl was fixing her hair next to me, while some weird old man in tidy-whities came in to take a dump, all in not a very large space. Weird! The bathroom was well-maintained, but couldn't we at least have separate men's and women's bathrooms!? That is too Euro-trashy for my taste. Also the price was OK for New York, but I think still too expensive given the bathroom situation. I am not sure I would stay here again, but it did make for a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “The best low-cost hotel I've found in NYC”
Reviews.Author: tarichard
Reviews.Content: I read about The Jane a couple of years ago and put it on my list of places to try. I stay in all sorts of places and don't mind spending money when I get the utility (I flew BA Club Class this trip to NYC) but I don't like spending money on a large room in NYC that I'll just sleep in. The Jane is nearly perfect in this regard. It was cheap for NYC (I paid $100 a night) which compares to The Pod Hotel I've stayed in before and even run-down flea pits like The Larchmont. Bearing in mind the new Yotel here is about $300 a night and The Jane is a bargain. But you get what you pay for. The single room is tiny as everyone on here notes so I wasn't surprised. But there was enough storage space above and below the bed to keep my stuff out of the way. I couldn't work out what was original and what was new in the room. They've been very well renovated down to the fake faded carpet that looks old but cannot be. The free wifi throughout the hotel was strong and fast. The staff are great. The bar, lounge and cafe are like stepping back into another era. In a good way. Negatives: arriving at 12.30am I needed my sleep and the two girls in the next room came back at 2am and were laughing and talking until 4am. The soundproofing isn't great. Next time, I'd call reception. Ignorant cows. The bar prices are surprisingly high for a hotel that charges $100 a night. $14 for a mojito is higher end bar prices. The prices fit the bar ambiance not the hotel's positioning. I would have preferred a small wash basin in the room (you get one in The Pod Hotel) and the room got quite hot at night and the fan is too noisy to have on when trying to sleep. I don't mind shared bathrooms (they were always clean and curiously empty when I needed to use them) and you're provided with slippers and a robe for the thrilling journey down the corridor. The rest of the guests seemed to be youngish and fashionable rather than entry-level bargain seekers. So I would return here very happily but wouldn't necessarily recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: FOV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jane with my 17 y/o daughter and it was perfect! Easy walk to Buddakan for a wonderful dinner and a short walk to Chelsea Market in the morning for great coffee and breakfast. We loved the decor of the hotel and the front desk. We got a bunk bed room, which was actually smaller than my closet at home. It was TINY! Smaller than a cruise ship room. It was what we were expecting so we were not shocked. It was so small my daughter took a picture and posted it to her Facebook page and got several comments. We had no problem with the shared bathroom, didn't run into anyone else using it. We prefer to stay at inexpensive, clean hotels that are in great neighborhoods because it allows us to travel more often. We also enjoy quirky places with lots of character and try to avoid the big chains whenever possible. In NYC there is so much to do we only use our hotel room for sleep. The Jane bunkbed room is too small for anything but sleeping so if you will spend a lot of time in your room this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “just what i needed”
Reviews.Author: weisenbergda
Reviews.Content: The Jane is in a great neighborhood, as a solo female traveler I was comfortable. The room is small but cozy with all that a lady needs. The shared bathrooms were clean and the showers were nicer than expected. Great restaurant downstairs with tasty dishes and waitstaff. No complaints here.....I will check into the Jane next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been nice”
Reviews.Author: screen180572
Reviews.Content: What have could have been great experience ended up in a big disapointment. The whole style and website has a very positive spirit. And coming into the hotels is also very nice with the dressed employees. But the room......closet where you sleep in is very disapinting. It is a little more than 1,5 by 2,0 m with only a bed of 80 cm by 190 cm, The lounch bar will make this good. But the toilet on my floor was too dirty to sit on. Ok you can go to another place as man to the toilet. Because the lounge was very nice and there would be a DJ playing from 23PM I decided to come with my friends to the hotel. The bad thing was that we where rejected. Rekection is not a problem but how they treat you with rejecting you while you are a client in the building is really disapointing,

Reviews.Title: “You just have to love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CypressPat
Reviews.Content: Here's the thing - I don't think a single thing in this hotel has changed in 100 years. And that is the beauty of it. The rooms are tiny - I mean teeny, tiny. But, when I'm in New York, it is 'just me,' and who cares!?! The room, as tiny as it was, brimmed with gorgeous wood and clever uses of space. No closet - just a couple of hooks on the door (but drawers under the bed). You couldn't stay here for a week (you'd go a little crazy) but for 2-3 nights, it is great. This place is stuck in time and it hasn't had to change in 100 years because it is perfect just the way it is. Think Titanic - nineteenth century charm throughout. The staff was cheerful and sincerely helpful and really went out of their way to make my stay pleasant. Cannot beat its downtown location...RIGHT on the Hudson River. I really love this place and will definitely stay there again next time I'm in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “For the price...it's amazing”
Reviews.Author: SF2UK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Jane twice now. Once when I was in NYC for a wedding and once when I was there for business. In a city where you'd be hard pressed to find a room under $300/night during the week...The Jane was an awesome find. Obviously if you are looking for a luxury stay at a 5 star hotel...this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a clean place to sleep, a little off the beaten path, a little funky (in a cool way...not in a smelly way), in an amazing area...look no further. I won't go into the details about the size of the room, shared baths, etc...as if you're reading about the hotel I'm assuming you know that already. What I will talk about is that I did feel relatively safe (it is NYC), felt the room was clean and the staff was friendly. And I liked the idea of sleeping in a "bunk". I guess the lights could be brighter in the room, and there were a few times I went to the shower and there was hair on the floor (which is a major gross out thing for me), but I just remembered to bring my flip flops the 2nd time I stayed and it was fine. I guess what I'm trying to say...is there are some tradeoffs of course...but at the end of the day...you can't beat the price, location and quaintness. Unless I hit the lottery...I plan on staying at The Jane every time I travel to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “ambiance and history 5 stars - comfort? - eh”
Reviews.Author: MaEastCoastGirl
Reviews.Content: I've been to Manhattan numerous times. Staying in Queens, NJ, and also in the city. Out of all the places I've stayed, I loved this location the best. I'm not into Times Square and the crowds, I like off the beaten path and this is it. An easy walk to The West Village, Washington Sq., Bleeker St, Houston St., Soho, and Canal St. Keep in mind, easy for me = interesting, which could be at least a 1/2 hour walk. But that's what I go to the city for...to EXPLORE! We stayed in a twin bunk cabin with a communal bathroom which was a first for me. Hey, gotta try everything at least once! The actual bedroom is SO tiny. There really isn't ANY floor space for 2 people to put their things AND get changed. I will not suggest this room if you're staying for any length of time since there is no place to put anything other than the 2 drawers under the bottom twin bed. Your suitcases will take up what little floor space there is. We stayed one night which was enough for me in such a small room. The room got VERY hot at night. The heat is not regulated room by room but set on a main thermostat. We had to leave our window opened a crack but then in the middle of the night we were cold. The lighting in the room is VERY dim. Not bright enough to put makeup on and know what it's actually going to look like outside. The bathroom lighting is a tad brighter at night, but still, not at the best angle to apply makeup.They should add a couple of lighted makeup mirrors in the bathrooms for accuracy! For a one night stay...the lighting and the tiny room was tolerable. The bathroom is VERY spacious...the actual toilet doors run from floor to ceiling so you have complete privacy as are the shower units themselves. There were 2 toilets and 2 showers in the bathroom at the end of our hall. The shower area is huge...big enough to bring all your things into the actual shower stall. Have to figure out how to keep the stuff dry though. Even though the shower head runs straight down, mist will get on your clothes so be careful. What makes up for the dim small room is the decor of the building and location! VERY cool. If you like history, and old time ambiance...this is the place. The restaurant just off the lobby was delicious for breakfast...try the avocado toast...very yummy. Beautifully decorated, in that same old time flare and very comfortable to relax and enjoy your meal. A little pricey, but not outrageous that you can't get a bagel, muffin, or coffee and go broke.

Reviews.Title: “You'll really sleep tight at The Jane”
Reviews.Author: PWinCT
Reviews.Content: We wanted to escape home and the winter doldrums, but every hotel in New York was through the roof for Presidents' Weekend. Then we found that proverbial needle in a haystack -- an actual bargain. Not just cheap. Dirt cheap! The Jane. Only 99 bucks a night. OK, as they say, you get what you pay for, and here's what we were paying for: a teensy-weensy room (and I use the word "room" loosely; you'd be better off thinking "closet"), equipped with bunk beds...and not much else. You use a shared bathroom down the hall. My husband and I are not young. Far from. Nor are we hipsters, like the enormous crowd of attractive, 20-something club-goers we had to wade through late Saturday night just to get inside the front door. Also,once inside, we discovered one reason why the hotel might bear its name -- the elevators and hallways have a distinct scent of something once known as Mary-Jane. The room (by which I mean closet, although maybe you should forget closets, since it has none) brought to mind the efficiently designed compartments you find on overnight trains. It was only as long as its two stacked twin-sized beds (just over 6 feet) and offered less than 3 feet of space between the beds and the wall. Then again, if you don't bring much luggage, how much space do you need? The beds were comfortable, and each was equipped with its own flat-screen TV, giving it the feel of an airplane seat. As for those public bathrooms, there are two on each hallway with ultramodern fixtures offering two toilets, two sinks and two shower compartments with doors. All bathrooms are unisex, and you will find yourself getting very intimate with strangers very quickly. Then again, uou use public restrooms when you're in a restaurant, mall or a plane. Why not a hotel? One morning, my husband was shaving when a woman stepped out of the shower with a towel on her head and another draped around her shoulders. Nothing below the waist. "Morning," she said nonchalantly. Made his day. OK, so it wasn't the most elegant hotel experience we've ever had. Maybe it was the least. But in NYC, I'd rather spend my money on food, theater, and shopping. And The Jane's environs, the Meatpacking District, is prime turf for the first and last of those. We slept fine. We had fun. We will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “booked 3 nights left after the first.”
Reviews.Author: jamielynnanddavid
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of fantastic reviews about this budget glory, I was sure that we were going to get along just fine. I was wrong. In college, I lived in the dorms and, At the time, it seemed like glamorous fun to share a 150 square foot room with another person, and share bathrooms down the hall with everyone on my floor. In retrospect? It sucked. To compare, this is even worse. The Bed: at 5'6 I reach the end of the mattress when I lie down. This means that my feet are practically in the shelves at the end of the bed. Also, the matress thickness is about that of a cot. Not comfortable. I suppose they try to balance this by having feather pillows and high threadcount sheets but it just seems a pittance. The noises: You can hear everything. Your next door neighbors telephone conversations, music, and tv. You can even hear sounds from the bathrooms all the way down the hall (I was about 14 doors down and could hear flushing). The light: There are two lights in this small abode, one above with a yellow wash/low wattage, and one over the bed. Turning both on together did not make it bright enough to do my makeup in the room and the yellowness of the lights made it feel like I was in some low budget horror movie. Little whines: I couldn't get the internet on my ipad to work, it required flash and java which ipads don't have. WTG Jane. My key was touch and go, if you held it just the right way and twisted left it worked. They require that you put your key in the wall to get elecrticity to work. This means when gone I can't charge cameras, laptops or phones. There is one window which directly faces another window. It's chest high which means that I kept it closed 100% of the time. For a room that small, the window would have been nice. The one time I went into the bathroom the floor was sopping wet, the counters were sopping wet, and the seat was up. Just gross. I checked in at 2pm and by 7pm I had decided that this room was more like a jail cell than a hotel room. For someone who does not get clostrophobic, I started to feel antsy and uncomfortable in the room. While in pictures the wood siding and red decor looked cute and quaint, in person it just felt heavy and made the room seem smaller than it was. 7:30pm hit and I had booked myself another room for the next two days confirming that the extra 50.00 a night I'm spending at Hotel Metro is more than worth it. And I get my own bathroom there. I wish I could have said more positive things about this hotel, but truth be told had it not been a holiday weekend and ALL the hotels were booked, I would have checked in and checked right out again.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this centrally located hotel in October 2011 for 4 nights. I am aware that finding good hotels in New York is difficult but when paying Â£250 (pounds not dollars) per night you expect something decent. The hotel itself wasnâ€™t bad - just medicore. However if you want some sleep do not stay here. The rooms are not very well sound proofed at all and there is a bar downstairs playing loud music until 4am. We complained about the noise from the bar (located inside the hotel) only to be told that there was nothing they could do because they had no jurisdiction over the bar - this was at 3.30am. I could here the conversation the people in the rooms next door were having often word for word. Even in the city that apparently never sleeps, the tourists that visit it do want to sleep at night. This is not the place to stay if you want peace and quiet. Despite complaining about the noise three times when we checked out no-one had offered to make any kind of reduction on the bill which would have been a reasonable gesture. The staff were apologetic but give the level of noise in the hotel I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, affordable, and hip”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: OK the rooms are really small but they tell you that up front, and where else can you stay for $99 in a trendy part of Manhattan? There is a French bistro on site. The Highline park is 2 blocks away. You don't need to bring a robe, slippers, hair dryer, shampoo, towels or soap. Great restaurants in the neighborhood. The radiator pipes do make some loud noises during the night, but not all the time.

Reviews.Title: “A true NY delight!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa E
Reviews.Content: I made my first trip to the Big Apple in Oct 2011 and was looking for something cheap and not too out of the way, without being made to stay in backpacker style accomodation. After reading the reviews it seemed I had found my place - after all, who comes to NY to hang out in a hotel room?! The Jane was fantastic. I arrived late in the evening (10pm) and after 24 hours of travelling I just wanted to lay down! The concierge was very helpful, and while he was taking copies of my ID there was an issue with the copier, so instead of making me stand around he organised a porter to take me to my room, and then promptly sent my documents to my room once the process was completed. The rooms are small, but the under and above bed storage means that there isn't a drama with falling over your bags in the middle of the night! Cable TV, an ipod dock, air con, comfy bed and all for $99 a night, how can you go wrong? It is a short walk to the subway, and is located in a lovely area that is currently being updated from its industrial past. I slept comfortably every night and never had to line up for the bathroom or to take a shower, no matter what time of day/night it was. The room keys are very cool, however they did raise some eyebrows at the 9/11 memorial, and it took some convincing that it wasn't a weapon!!!! I will definently be back and will recommend it to all and sundry!

Reviews.Title: “I strongly recomend!”
Reviews.Author: Flavia D
Reviews.Content: The placeÂ´s awsome, the staff always helpful and kind and the shared bathrooms were always clean and pleasant, just like my room. I'll certainly be there in my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hostel”
Reviews.Author: Andre1502
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out this small hotel offers a great service. Very friendly staff, clean rooms and incredible clean shared bathrooms. The rooms are really small ( the website shows it clearly ) are equiped with AC, heater, Flat Screen TV, DVD, Alarm Clock, confortable bed. The windows could be larger. The hotel smells good and is perfectly kept. Sleepers and a robe are part of the amenities. The showers ( individually separed ) offer shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. The toilets are always white as just cleaned. I stayed for 6 nights paying around USd 120 ( tax included ). The location is great. Close to Chelsea Market and dozens of bars and restaurants of the Meatpacking District ( very fancy ). There is a parking lot right across the street and subway can be reached in a 10 minute walk. A cab ride from Times Square to the Jane costs around USD 14 only. I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Compact cool”
Reviews.Author: Rach_Oz
Reviews.Content: I chose The Jane after reviews on this site and was pleased with the choice for my first NYC trip. Yes, the single cabins are compact and although I'm tall, it was not really a problem (okay, I could just about touch both ends of the compact room). But there's plenty of spaces to store belongings and ever increasing shopping purchases. The shared bathrooms was clean and I encountered few queues. I noticed the long term residents didn't really interact with hotel guests. A tele, radio, heating and comfy bed complemented by excellent downstairs cafe, the ballroom drinks venue and great location. It's an affordable and ship-shape option for single travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Compact luxury”
Reviews.Author: milkandnut
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling alone, and don't need a massive room at $300 up this could be your dream hotel. But it could easily become a total hell, if you dont know what you are getting into. Im 6'5, and I was worried that the beds would be too small. They are fine. Standard length and width single beds, with room at the end for your feet to hang off. Cant talk for the bunk rooms, but I expect the ends are closed in. The rooms are compact, but had everything i needed. Water, Wifi, nice towels, robe, slippers, pencil, pad, Ipod alarm, and a dvdTV. Loads of storage above and below the bed, including a safe. And house keeping were a pair of charming ladies, who would service my room as late as 5pm. The shared bathrooms are great. Nice products, good showers, never had to wait, and from the one at the end of the corridor a amazing view down to the statue of liberty. There were of course some stray hairs, and the odd damp patch on the floor, but overall it was kept really clean and tidy. Didnt use the cafe or the bar, but both looked nice enough. The staff were a total delight. Stored bags, shopping advice, they seemed to really enjoy and care about their jobs. And as for the location... If I ever have to move to Manhattan, I want to live on Jane St. Metro about 5min walk away, and cabs 24/7. But it wasn't all love... The heat Is UNBEARABLE. You will need the a/c on all night, so earplugs are must, as it is LOUD. It also means the any drinks you have will be tepid/warm if you leave them in the room. The a/c switches off when you leave, so it cant be left on the keep room cool. Also with the bed bug scare, I was a little put out to see the room opposite taped shut. I did check the room on arrival and found no evidence, but that did play on my mind.. Would I stay again..yes..but maybe in a captains room!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: LiserT
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Jane for New Years Eve. We loved it. The rooms are TINY. That being said, they are cozy and the attention to detail is impeccable. The bed was comfortable and the temperature was good with the help of the air conditioner. One thing I really liked about The Jane is that the rooms were pretty much soundproof. There were New Years parties happening in a bunch of rooms, but they could only be heard in the hallway. Once you got in your room, there was nothing but silence. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep not the place on a weekend, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Jabronie13
Reviews.Content: The Jane is a neat hotel and is super cute and the food in the restaurant is pretty darn good and the bar is cute. For New York the rooms (the ones with private bathrooms) are spacious and nice and the bathrooms are cute with a nice bathtub as are the outdoor decks. However, at best, it will cost you $400 a night and it does not seem worth it at all. Especially when you consider this: starting at around 10 PM (on weekends at least) loud music cranks up (specifically The Pony by Ginuine over and over again) with amplified bass and it is super loud, I can sleep through anything, but not this. During our stay, around 2 AM when this was still going on I called downstairs and the person at the desk - who seemed to be very used to getting calls about the noise levels - said that the music should stop around 3 AM and that he would ask them to turn down the bass. There was never a change in volume or bass level that I could tell and the music ended around 4 AM. It is a full on dance party - not a bar or even a music venue - a high bass, non-stop, high volume, dance party - as if you have stepped into a bad Britney Spears non-stop remix. The lower level floors are absolutely intolerable, not exaggerating, higher floors might be better, but even the higher level floors that look out into the courtyard, where music is also going, are probably effected, though perhaps not as much. The lack of sleep really did ruin the trip as our plan was to do stuff mostly during the day - hoping to get to sleep at least by 1 AM. Also while the fixtures and furnishing in the hotel are cute if you look closely they are not antique, but are mostly reproductions which makes things very Disney Landish/Anthropolgiesh - a bit phoney, for those who care about such. Mostly the experience felt more worth $200 or so New York dollars - not the double amount of $400! I wish the hotel would at least warn people that there is a full on dance party going on during the weekends and that volume is loud until 4 AM or so, this would allow people to plan and book accordingly. Now that the Chelsea is gone it is difficult to find a cute, historic, unique, reasonable hotel in New York and I do not have any suggestions for such, but I can say they were very nice at the Warwick and rates were under $200 and the Standard in Brooklyn, albeit totally different might be another thought. Also room service is horrible do not order it - the food is good, but everything arrives in to-go containers, it is more like a fast food in a meal situation than a room service presentation - walk down and get it to go and save some money on delivery if you want something in your room. Rooms and hallways are a little dark too, not a bother to me, but if you are looking for a bright, sunshine type situation this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant staff, but...”
Reviews.Author: Sandra S
Reviews.Content: Great location,very calm,polite staff and excellent cafe. But a real problem is with the the climate control especially the heating system that probably dates from the early 1900's. During my last stay this month I was so cold I had to sleep with my winter coat on. What was really disappointing was was that I paid 300 plus for a room that was barely heated (60F) and was not compensated for a really miserable night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Jane, mostly due to the fact that the price was far lower than most hotels I could find, and it wasn't a hostel. The staff were friendly, the location was quite good (and a short walk to the subway), and although the rooms were small I found it fairly comfortable. The in-house cafe/restaurant had some good food for breakfast, but the staff didn't seem interested in acknowledging me, even when I sat at the bar each time I went there, so the service was quite poor. Overall, good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: shirle111843
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Jane Hotel for the second time and was, again, very happy with the accommodations, the price, and especially the staff. In particular, Ashley and Alex who were working the front desk/lobby. They were both extremely courteous, helpful, pleasant and made the stay even better. I would definitely recommend the Jane Hotel for a truly different experience when staying in NYC. Will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “best rates in downtown manhattan”
Reviews.Author: tom63NewYork
Reviews.Content: well small rooms but clean and great location - where else can u get a room in ny for less than 100$

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Lenoxknits
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying I only spent one night at the Jane before my rental property was ready and honestly I'm glad I didn't spend my entire trip here. It is cute and in a nice, safe location. As I'm sure you are aware it is very small. I would have been extremely clauserphobic if I had been with my husband or another guest but for one night with just me it was a lovely stay. I walked to the Village and found my way back after a few beers without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Sauna or Sleep room.”
Reviews.Author: drpsych_californa
Reviews.Content: Ok. Well, I stayed in the summer and it worked for me and my needs. I stayed last night, and the room was so hot in temperature that I kept the window wide open and the air conditioning unit on. I won't speak of the bed bugs, as that' already been addressed in other posts. But, hey, to have a sleepless night in a 125 / night room is ridiculous. Then, the shower turned cold after 5 minutes, and I was asked by the front staff if "that got my heart beating", verbatim. So, in a nutshell, that part of my life is over, and I'm back to the Park Ave. Kimpton where life is well, civil again, and I have a room with correct, livable temperature, no bedbugs, and a shower that provides hot water. I can hardly wait for the post from THe Jane staff stating their apologies for providing a substandard lodging experience with no empathy. Best of luck to you, Jane.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: William D
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a unique hotel stay in one of the greatest neighborhoods in NY this is the place; Super affordable rates, excellent atmosphere, extremely friendly staff and comfortable rooms. I stayed for three nights at the Jane, and had an amazing stay. The atmosphere and charm of the hotel is un-mistakable. My room was a small single but I didn't mind the size in the least. I am 6.5 and was nervous about whether or not I would fit and be comfortable. Luckily, I was pleasantly surprised at how well the space works and how comfortable I felt. The small space is really cozy. The bed and the room are extremely comfortable. The shared bathroom is really clean and convenient. There are a lot of reviews on here about bedbugs and I was fortunate enough to not have any problems. I can't emphasize how clean the hotel was so I was surprised by these reviews. I would stay at the hotel again in a heartbeat. If you're looking for a unique hotel stay in one of the greatest neighborhoods in NY this is the place; Super affordable rates, excellent atmosphere, extremely friendly staff and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel and EXCELLENT staff”
Reviews.Author: RunningNurse
Reviews.Content: I visit NYC about 2-3 times each year. This visit was just my niece and myself, so we decided to "take a chance" on The Jane. I was very nervous about this visit. However, I am absolutely THRILLED with this cute little hotel. YES, the room is small and it is somewhat difficult for two people to move around in the room. However, once you get the hang of it, its really no problem at all. It was very much like my college dorm, but cleaner and quieter. The bathroom was very clean and even though this was a busy time, I never waited for a toilet or shower. My only complaint is the male guests who think it is ok to go into the bathroom wearing their boxers or tighty whities. The hotel rooms comes with a nice bathroom guys, USE IT. No one wants to see you in your underwear. The staff was OUTSTANDING. I have stayed in some of NYC's finest hotels and have never experienced such professional, friendly service. I hope the management realizes how valuable their staff is and that they make the experience. Robert, Ashley and the other desk girl with big glasses (sorry, I can't remember her name) were awesome !! No, I did not experience bedbugs. However, this is an epidemic in NYC and even the finer hotels are having a tough time keeping the problem in check. This is the best value in NYC !!

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are crawling with bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: camarofox
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister on November 30 in one of the rooms with bunk beds. We had originally booked 2 nights but our trip got cut short after I got eaten alive by bedbugs in 2 of the rooms. After discovering bites around 2 a.m., I got suspicious and googled "bedbugs jane hotel" on my phone and found this: http://bedbugregistry.com/location/NY/10014-1700/New-York/113-Jane-St/. I called the front desk and told them that I was getting bitten and asked if we could switch rooms. I wanted to leave but since it was the middle of the night I figured we could try another room. The concierge asked if I had seen any actual bugs and I said no. They said they would move us but to wait on the bellhop because there was a "process". The bellhop finally showed up after I called twice and in the meantime we had trapped a bug I saw crawling on my sheets under an empty water glass as evidence. He told us he was going to have to take all of our stuff and steam it and they would return it in the morning. After moving rooms and finally dozing off to sleep, I awoke around 6 a.m. to more bites that were itching like crazy and switched on the light to see another bug crawling across the sheets. At that point I had had enough and called down to the front desk and asked them to bring us our stuff and told them we were checking out immediately. The bellhop brought up our stuff and it was bagged in trashbags and some of it was still damp. We got dressed in the bathroom because we didn't want to run the risk of any bugs getting in our stuff that had just been treated. We checked out and the concierge comped our room without us having to ask but didn't apologize, although I will say to their credit the staff was very polite and helpful throughout the whole ordeal. It's really a shame this is such a problem because the hotel is so cute with so much history and in a great neighborhood for a great price. I've been to the ballroom several times and threw a friend a baby shower in the restaurant last month and had great experiences each time. As a New Yorker, I know how much of an issue bedbugs are in this city, but it is appalling that the hotel knows that this has been a problem for years and continues to rent out the infested rooms night after night. I found one bug on my toilet that must have traveled home with me in my underwear (I hope it was the only one!), have some bites that swelled up to welts the size of baseballs, and am still itching days later. Needless to say, I definitely will not be staying here again or recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “loved the jane”
Reviews.Author: yaya220
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August with my son. Tiny room, but excellent quiet area. Staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “more bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie A
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 3 nights. Loved the hotel, the room was even smaller than expected but still it had character. Shared washroom was clean and nice. Loved the location. However, I too encountered bed bags - I am covered in bites, at least 30. Never considered it could be bed bugs, spoke to the person at the desk when we checked out and he indicated they have had no cases for years so thought maybe it was something that came in the window. I have now been home for 4 nights and I can't sleep because of the itching!! I did some more research and realized that it has to be bed bugs. Luckily I suspected that so washed everything at home. Seriously hope I didn't bring any back with me because these bites are driving me crazy!! Unfortunately this has turned the trip of a lifetime into a hellish experience. I definitely won't risk returning ever.

Reviews.Title: “Most value for money?”
Reviews.Author: zuune
Reviews.Content: The Jane is probably one of the most valuable hotel right now, at least from my experience in NY. The service is excellent, all staff friendy and always ready to assist. Even if the rooms are SMALL (buy who will be in NY to sleep) and there is shared showers, the value of the hotel is in the service and the staff. One simple example: instead of standing waiting for your taxi, take a drink in the neighbor bar and the staff comes and get you when the taxi has arrived. Another example is that the baggage storage, including Alia me stuff get stored at the office.

Reviews.Title: “Up till 3am with the noise from club downstairs.....”
Reviews.Author: LESLEY_ANNScotland
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at the Jane, I loved it the last time,although I had a room at the backs then. This time we had a tiny room on Jane Strret which was on the 3rd floor and the night time noise was unbelievable. The ballroom downstairs had music on till around 3am...although I am a light sleeper and had walked around all day and was very tired, I could not block the noise out. The shower has great water pressure..no problems sharing.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted from my accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: Niffyfoxes
Reviews.Content: The Jane is situated halfway between midtown and downtown, ideal for getting about. 5 mins walk from 14th Street subway or $10 in a yellow cab to Times Square. If you don't intend to spend a lot of time in your room, want somewhere clean, secure and friendly I would definitely recommend this place. Free wifi, tv and iPod docking station are a bonus. I would definitely recommend and i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hip, trendy, too hot and too damn loud”
Reviews.Author: thedudeinvienna
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Jane for four nights when I was in NYC for the marathon. First of all, my room was $325 a night, not including tax, which seemed very steep, even for NYC. My room was tiny, with about 2 1/2 feet of space between the bed and the walls. The bathroom was a nice size, however. The hotel staff was generally very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is located on the west side highway, so I can only imagine how loud the rooms are on this side of the hotel. When I checked in I asked for a quiet room and was told that my room faced Jane Street, so it would probably be not be too loud. What the front desk attendant didn't mention was the super loud club that operates in the hotel seven nights a week. I was in room 215 and it was so loud as to be unpleasant and I'm sure a light sleeper would have been driven insane by the music. Another complaint is that apparently the heating system dates from the time the hotel was originally built and it turned my room into a sauna - I was told by a staff member that the heat cannot be turned down because it is an old system. So, every time I returned to my room it was about 100 degrees F (37 degrees C). The only option was to open the window (which also lets in street noise) or to run the air conditioner for a few hours until the temperature is brought under control. Now for the good stuff. The hotel is located adjacent to the West Village which is a totally awesome neighborhood with cafes, bars, restaurants, the new highline park, and the chelsea market nearby. The hotel is a totally cool, trendy place. When I was there the restaurant was shut down for a photo shoot. The wifi worked well. If you want to stay in a totally cool hotel, this may be the place for you. If you want a good night's sleep, I suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love it”
Reviews.Author: Amberp1984
Reviews.Content: I just spent one week here in a cabin and I loved it. The room had everything I needed, the bed was very comfortable, the showers were hot and the staff were friendly and helpful. Yes, the rooms are small but are you coming to New York to hang out in your hotel?? I requested a quiet room and it was perfect; the first time I haven't needed earplugs in New York. I'll definitely be back and will be recommending it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Such a quaint place. Loved our room over looking the Hudson.”
Reviews.Author: BJJ12
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect spot for us. We could walk to the High Line and ate in some cozy little places. It was in walking distance to my daughter's apartment. The hotel stafff was wonderful. I felt like they were waiting up for us when we got back and always wanted to hear how our day went.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: measuredmile
Reviews.Content: Shared bath: yes. Tiny rooms: yes. But given what they had to work with, management has done a terrific job at providing clean rooms with up-scale detailing and great service at a value price. A friend and I stayed there last week for two nights. Once I figured out the shower routine (Change into one of the provided robes, then proceed. Showers are too small to change inside.) it went well. Outside traffic was noisy - bring good earplugs if you need quiet to sleep - but once in the room I didn't hear anything from the hall. The neighborhood is full of great restaurant and shopping choices and the walk from the subway is easy. Don't miss cocktails at the top of the Standard, a hotel on Washington Avenue on the Highline just a few blocks from the hotel. I'm definitely planning to make The Jane my NYC pied Ã  terre from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: bnimo
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Jane. The location was great. 10 minute walk from the subway and right across West St from the Hudson. Small lobby with great, helpful staff. First view of the room as I opened the door was a little disconcerting. It was very small. But nice woodwork, very tidy and plenty of storage and hanging space. And since I was only there from midnight til 7:00 the next morning it was fine. Bathroom down the hall was never crowded and always clean. There are bicycles to use for free, a nice cafe and the whole place just has a lot of character. It was fun imagining the hotel filled with seamen back in the day. I'm already planning another trip there. Jordan

Reviews.Title: “WET KEY”
Reviews.Author: OXMINSTER
Reviews.Content: In addition to my previous two reviews of The Jane, ...this time round was pleasant, yet a reality check. Stayed in a single, in the back, 5th floor, ...quiet, lovely. Sunday morning, donned the hotel robe and slippers for a shower. After washing up, returned to the room, ...to find that my key did not work! Traipse downstairs to the front desk to be told that if the key gets 'wet,' it will be deactivated. Huh? ...I wasn't Swimming with the key, let alone having dripping wet hands. As a result, you leave the patron paranoid that, whilst I packed my bag and was ready to leave my cabin a little later, if I go to the bathroom first to brush my teeth before setting off, to return to my cabin to pick up my bag to check-out, I might find myself Locked Out of my cabin, having to Traipse downstairs, to return right back upstairs, just because the "idea" of having the key around the bathroom to brush my teeth, might get the key Wet. Suggestion to management: Please highlight this point about the key, and getting wet, to all at time of check-in, ...saves us the feeling of WTF?! during the moment of being locked out. Traipsing down to the front desk half naked was of no matter, ...momentarily having a spot of bother over something that appears to happen occasionally/often, was! You're still loved.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for me to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a cabin room on the 6th floor at the Jane for 8 nights in August, 2011. I was traveling alone to NYC for the very first time and had a wonderful stay at the Jane. It was the perfect place for me as a solo traveler because it was inexpensive compared to other options, but you get great value for your money! Yes, the rooms aren't much more than a bed and a bit of space to put your stuff, but if you are in New York City why would you want to spend time in your hotel room other than to sleep? The staff at the Jane were all very polite and happy to do what they could to make your stay wonderful. The bathrooms are shared, but they are frequently cleaned, and I never had a problem with their cleanliness, or having to wait to use one. Brushing your teeth in the morning, don't forget to look out of the window for a distant view of the Statue of Liberty! The hotel includes free WiFi which I took advantage of. The connection seemed to be very stable and the speed was great (compared to other hotels I have stayed at). I also really liked the location of the Jane. In west village, it is right at the end of Jane Street, very close to the Hudson River, and the Hudson River Bike Path which follows the west shore. While I was staying at the hotel I recorded a video tour and review of the hotel which you can watch on YouTube for more details: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iRTFgR0NfsM

Reviews.Title: “Cool vibe and unbeatable value”
Reviews.Author: Yellodiamond
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on previous trip advisors reviews of top class cleanliness and no bed bugs. I was prepared for shoe-box rooms. As a female solo traveller, it's always a challenge to find somewhere safe and affordable in cities. I was beyond pleasantly surprised every moment I stayed, sure the rooms are small but not tiny (when you're one) and this is NYC! Paris rooms are tinier. The hotel staff were always helpful and welcoming, no question was a problem and any queries were dealt with immediately with warmth and humour. The building is steeped in history and has a great feel to it. Everything i needed was provided: safe, drawers, TV, ipod dock, dressing gown, towels, slippers. The location is cool, I had many new york moments strolling the village streets. Subway is 5-10 minute walk, totally doable. The bathrooms were always pristine in terms of cleanliness and I rarely had to wait. No bed bugs either. The cafe downstairs was in keeping with the hotel and served a great selection for breakfast. I have and will continue to recommend this bargain hotel to anyone i know staying in NYC. The only downsides for me was the room did smell of smoke, and this did linger on my clothes that were not in drawers when i returned home. The air-con when switched meant the smell wasn't obvious when I was in the room. and it was v noisy to keep on at night but that wasn't an issue as i could turn it off - not sure about summer. Very honest staff too, I realised i had left something behind on my return home and they had found it and arranged for it to be sent on. I cannot praise this hotel high enough, for a budget hotel, it really adds to the new york experience for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish and good feel of Chelsea District”
Reviews.Author: Alice N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading reviews on TripAdvisor, and also because we wanted to have a budget-friendly trip (except for staying in hostels). Although the rooms were extremely tiny (unless you are tiny, two people/room is almost too much!) however we did begin our trip with the notion that we aren't there to sleep/spend time in the room but to discover the city. I loved the front desk area, with the beautiful decorations and wall artifacts. Even the porters and their uniforms very much set the tone for this hotel! I loved every aspect of it, as I have always been used to the straight-up modern hotels such as the Holiday Inn. We didn't mind the single-sex washrooms either, they did not smell, were not dirty, and extremely well maintained. We appreciated the quiet area of the neighbourhood, not sketchy, and although I had been expecting it to be noisy from some reviews about it being a clubby area, we were on the 4th floor, and were not disturbed at all from any disturbances! So if you are a budget traveller who does not mind a couple of nights in a small room, do check this out as your place to stay in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Catherine T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a captains room while not large it was comfortable with a nice bathroom.The cafe had a good selection for breakfast and the evening meal we had was very good ,but make sure you leave the right tip,we got our sums wrong and felt very embarrassed to be told so on leaving!!Very near to the high-line walkway a must see,right on the river so some lovely walks.I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, tiny price”
Reviews.Author: dottravels
Reviews.Content: Feels like you're on a ship - narrow halls, tiny rooms, great front desk. Incredible location - close to river, highline, west village, etc. Very quiet. Really nice cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with noisy air condition”
Reviews.Author: Anders O
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in a standard cabin on fourth floor room 451. I would definitely recommend this hotel if there were not for two things, bed bugs and a very noisy air condition. First the rooms are very small but they their job very good. They are practical and comfortable even if they are very tiny. The shared bath rooms worked very well and were always clean. Only at one occasion I had to wait otherwise there was always a free toilet or shower when I need one. The small room and the common bath rooms are compensated by the lower price compared too many NYC hotels. Personally I rather spend my money in nice restaurant, bar or go shopping. The location in West Village and Meat Packing District is very good and itâ€™s a short walk to the subway on 14th St and 8 Ave. There are a lot of nice restaurants and bars on walking distance. It only takes some 15-20 minutes to walk to Chelsea, Greenwich Village and Soho. Setback no 1: There were bed bugs in the room and I got bitten on several places on the body. After I left the hotel the bite marks went away after a week but they were itching quite a lot in the beginning. Setback no 2: The air condition was extremely NOISY. It was impossible to sleep with air con switched on and as the rooms are very small they get very warm and I had difficulties to sleep some the nights, especially when it was warm outside. I complained at the front desk and they sent a guy to fix it but there was no improvement. If it not was for these 2 setbacks I would definitely recommend the hotel for someone who is looking for nice hotel at good price. Without these setbacks I would have ranked the hotel higher.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs :(”
Reviews.Author: SJSBrissygirl
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this hotel. Yes the rooms are tiny but the location is fantastic. However it appears from my experience that the hotel has a bed bug problem in its bunk rooms. I stayed in room 360 and woke in the middle of the night having been bitten very badly. We also saw bed bugs crawling up the walls and we caught a few to show the front desk. We had all our belongings taken away for steam treatment and were moved to room 342, another bunk room. Unfortunately room 342 had bugs as well and we had to go through the whole treatment regime again. We were then moved to a captains cabin room 218. No bugs thankfully and a very nice room, but I would recommend anyone staying on level 2 to bring ear plugs due to the very loud music playing at the bar downstairs to 4 or 5 in the morning some nights. The staff and manager were sympathetic and took a few nights off my 16 night bill but it was a very upsetting and stressful experience. I was bitten badly and suffered pain and itching my whole holiday. I wanted to like this hotel but I wont stay there again and I cant recommend it unless youre going to stay in a captains cabin room.

Reviews.Title: “great price,great location,great hospitality=wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melrose5235
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jane this weekend. Rooms are small but comfortable &cozy. Staff is excellent. Extremely clean bathroom(which is shared).Only negative:slow elevator.Highly recommended!If you ever get the chance,give the Jane a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the single traveler.”
Reviews.Author: CMic88
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at The Jane Hotel! Located in the cultural hub of the MePa district and a short stroll into Chelsea and Grenwich Village, there was always something happening in this exciting part of NYC. Although a little far away from the nearest subway stop and even buses, there is so much to see as you walk there, you hardley notice. Staff are friendly and the rooms always clean. Be warned, as everyone has mentioned, the rooms are tiny, and if your the sort of person who likes to spread your things out then you may want to opt for one of the larger rooms or another hotel. My experiance here was the best that I had in NYC and I will definently recommend this to any single traveller! Thank You Jane Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A special experience and unique for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Cosmos_Estrela
Reviews.Content: Finding a good hotel in NYC can be treacherous. Finding a decently priced hotel in a good location seems almost impossible, until The Jane came along. We booked one of their bunk bed rooms as for once we didnÂ´t want to pay an arm and leg for lodging in NYC and $125 a night is almost unbeatable. While checking in we were told we were upgraded to a Captains room, meaning that we had a bigger room and our own bathroom instead of a shared bathroom, which was definitely a nice surprise. Even though we ended up in a more expensive room, we enjoyed the service and atmosphere in the hotel, regardless of it. The people at the front desk were friendly and helpful and the interior design is unique and in line with the history of the building. And the location is unbeatable if you want to explore lower Manhattan. We also checked out the bunk bed rooms and they are small, so you get what you pay for, but the design is nice and the shared bathroom was clean and looked decent. The complimentary bath rooms and slippers definitely make a trip to the shared bathroom easier. The only reason why it didnÂ´t get an excellent rating is that both nights we were awoken by loud music from a bar that is either part of the Jane or very close by. We were on the second floor so the music may not be as bothersome on the higher floors. Regardless of this we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bov_3
Reviews.Content: I booked this place last minute and was delighted with this place. It is so quirky. I was in a single room and it is exactly like a ship cabin but with a flat screen tv included. The bathrooms are shared on the floor I was staying on. They are clean and they had a fantastic shower. It didn't bother me at all to share them. It was like a super posh hostel but with your own private space. The concierge and desk staff are also very helpful. There is loads to see and do in the area and the High Line is right behind the hotel. The only disadvantage that I found was that it is a few blocks away from public transport. The hotel is located at the very end of Jane street and I wasn't comfortable walking down there on my own at night time but that was a personal choice as I was travelling on my own at the time. This isn't a five star fancy hotel but I would definitely recommend this place and it was very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are too small”
Reviews.Author: Bex2811
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay at The Jane after looking at the website and seeing the vintage style and art deco decor. Me & my friend were on the second leg of a trip to Toronto and New York and had been travelling for 12 hours on a Greyhound and just wanted to dump our bags, get a shower and get back out to see the sights. When we got there the hotel staff were really friendly, helpful and speedy. We got up to our floor and got a bit lost with the layout. The number of the room was not on the key so it got a bit confusing when we got the room number wrong. We got to the room and could not believe how small it was! There was the two bunk beds and then about a foot of space in between the beds and the wall/mirror. Therefore we couldn't get dressed at the same time. Have to say though, this made the last day easier as we had to keep our suitcases packed the whole time! I was aware it would be shared bathrooms before going so that was not an issue. But I was glad that I never had to wait for a toilet or a shower which was really good. The beds are pretty comfy, the hotel is pretty quiet and there was a tv that each bed could see but ran by one remote. Beds are made every day and new towels provided daily. Also you are provided with a bathrobe and slippers. Showers are fitted with shampoo/conditioner/shower gel dispensers and the bathrooms have hairdryers fitted. On our last day the hotel staff were super friendly and kept our luggage for the day and booked us a taxi to the airport. All in all I wouldn't recommend this hotel as, even though you don't spend a lot of time in the hotel, you need the space to get ready and keep your stuff! Also, if you don't know New York (which I didn't) and you want to do tourist-y stuff (which I did) it is too far away really from anything and I found the Subway really confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Returning again”
Reviews.Author: Jchgo972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jane last fall due to a friend's recommendation since I couldn't find a decent hotel under $400 (everything was booked and expensive due to a conference and fashion week). I was apprehensive about the shared bathroom and small room since I was traveling for work but it was fine and only $99. Sidebar: my co-workers stayed at a popular brand hotel that week for $400-$600 and ended up leaving due to bed bugs. The room is very small (cruise ship like) but I wasn't in there much and I would work in the bistro downstairs anyway. NOT a fan of shared bathrooms but they were extremely clean - initially I was uncomfortable but then realized that everyone was in the same situation. I did have a neighbor who lived in the hotel permanently (and has been there for years) - he hung out in the hall way all the time but was very cordial and entertaining. He advised me that one of the floors had a better shower since our floor was crowded... I am sure many people would find him odd but I loved seeing him every time I left my room lol Overall, the hotel is not for everyone and for $99-$125 this is a bargain given the location, staff, cleanliness and amenities. I booked my room for late October again and look forward to staying here again. I also really respect the fact that the management responds to most of the posts on here (the level of service is higher than your average chain hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: HelenFromUK T
Reviews.Content: I would definitley stay here again. I was due to arrive on the day that Irene was due to strike NYC so I emailed the hotel to tell them my plans had changed - the manager replied pretty quickly saying I could change the dates of my reservation penalty free. I arrived late at night and was unsure about the location of the hotel at first in the dark, I thought it was a bit out of the way, but in daylight it is fine and its easy to walk to the main drag. The staff were curteous and helpful and when I asked a question about getting to JFK early in the morning I was given very good advice from the guy on the front desk, whose name I unfortunatly don't remember. The room its self was very small, but I think this added to the charm of its Titanic theme and it wasn't a problem for me (I was staying alond seen as my friend could not get there due to the hurricane threat). It was bunk beds which weren't the most comfortable thing I've ever slept on but after a day in the city were ok to recouperate on. The only issue I had with the well thought out and well equiped room was storage. There were 2 draws under the bed and some random hooks around the room but I had quite a bit of stuff and if my friend had arrived in the end I know we would have had a real issue. The communal bathrooms were also a pleasent suprise - clean and again well equiped - I also really liked the complimentary bathrobe and slippers. Overall I am really glad I picked this place and I wouldn't hesitate to recomend it to someone else or book another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay, disappointed on the second.”
Reviews.Author: uscballer9
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at The Jane and it was disappointing. I was given room 537A which is a corner room with great views of The Hudson River and Statue of Liberty. The room was small but it's nothing new to me and I loved that I get a little breeze coming in since it was a bit warm. You also get a view of a busy highway and can hear cars going by night and day, which is also not a problem with me since I'm not a light sleeper. What I have a problem with on this trip however is the cleanliness of my room and the shared bathrooms down the hall. To be fair, this is my second time at The Jane, so what I had encountered here are nothing new. My room gets a lot of visits from pigeons and they do a lot of things by my window. They eat, sleep and of course relieved themselves. There were plenty of pigeons' droppings right by my window and as far as I can see they're not new, which led me to believe that all these droppings have accumulated over a long period of time. What also happened was some of the feathers flew into and got stuck on my screen. After all this I couldnt helped but think what kind of air have I been breathing into my lungs or should I be worried about bird flu? The next problem is the shared bathrooms. Most of the time they were clean and I know housekeepers have been doing their job since I've seen them cleaning many times. However at a certain time when I come in, there seems to be a leak which I'm not sure it's coming from the sinks or from the showers. What I also discovered on my last morining was a few red bums on my arm which possibly have resulted from bed bugs. I did not look around to confirm my suspicions since I had to get ready to check out. Room 537A might be an isolated incident but it's definitely worth the attention of housekeeping and maintenance staffs. As you can see I have nothing but the best things to say about this hotel on my first stay. A lot of things went wrong on my second time here and they need to be fixed. On a higher note, I lost my wallet on the way to the hotel and the front desk staffs helped me in every way they can with check-in in regards to room charges and incidental deposit, which I greatly appreciated. I'd love to come back to The Jane on my next visit to NYC since I love everything else about the place.

Reviews.Title: “The Jane Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2011 having read good reviews on here. I have to say, I was disappointed, The rooms are tiny, with a small bed (not good for tall people), and whilst the bathrooms are clean with decent facilities, they are shared between quite a few people. This hotel does, however have some redeeming features, such as the efficiency and helpfulness of the staff, the cleanlyness of the place and the history associated with it. However for the money you pay, you can do a lot better elsewhere. On a side issue (and not directly related to the hotel) whilst the West Village/Chelsea is great to visit, I would not advise staying there for too long as the 'poncyness' of the whole place will get to you. For something a bit more genuine and relaxed try the lower East side, midtown Manhattan or Brooklyn.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful: they make you pay 50 dollars per night as a deposit”
Reviews.Author: crescenzomele_11
Reviews.Content: Ok, The Jane Hotel is for many aspects a little gem. Gorgeous lobby bar with young skinny upper class girls and boys who have fun until 4 am, well dressed and very good looking. But they are accompanied by drivers in rolls royce and even don't look at you, too rich for the hotel customers, they make you understand they have nothing to share with you, The rooms are provided with some comfortable facilities such as safe, hooks, tv. . I was at the fifth floor, no noise nor from the large street beneath river Hudson nor from the bar at the ground floor. Rooms are tidy with the bed done every day and towels changed every day. Toilets and showers always clean and not busy. Staff was enormously nice and helpful. The must are location in Meatpacking, the coolest quarter of NYC, full as it is of fancy restaurants and bars, very close to glamour High Line, packed with restored industrial properties , now totally gentrified. five minutes walk from Chelsea Market, an amazing attraction, and opposite River Hudson Park with its faboulous running path and breathless view over lower Manhattan, the river and New jersey skyline, 10 minutes walk from Green Village and clubs as the stunning and unique Blue Note. Never listened to such heavenly jazz music, believe me. Fantastic. Breakfast at CafÃ¨ Gitane with models being pictured for Vogue is a lovely experience. The must is free bikes you have to return within 7 pm but for me a very comfortable plus to visit the city, moving beetween museums, central park (biking there is a real funny experience) and restaurants and bars. Rooms are very tiny but you already know. The manager of the hotel replies that people who do not feel confortable with this kind of rooms can choose captain's rooms. They are very spacious but he don't tells they are too overpriced. Air conditioning is too old and noisy and if you want to sleep you have to switch it off. You can't leave it on when you're out as they work only with the key room being put into the wall. This results in too hot (i stayed the first days of septemper) and I imagine too cold temperature in winter.But the shame is 50 dollars per night they make you pay as a deposit.They make you sign a conditions acceptance where that is stated in very small letters and you don't notice it untill you mobile warns you your vredit card has been charged with it. The web site doesn't talk about that. I protested with the manager, He said no hotel does. I stayed 10 nights and I have been charged with 500 dollars. You have undestood well: 500 dollars. They said i would have had money back in twelve hours or maximum 2 days. Two days have gone and I still haven't had. A real theft.

Reviews.Title: “We paid $125 to sleep in a closet.”
Reviews.Author: Camyro1
Reviews.Content: Wear your flip flops in the shower. It's a weird feeling to have strange men sharing the bathroom with you. Great for ppl under 30. I wish they had separate bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “the jane is a gem”
Reviews.Author: traceydive
Reviews.Content: staying in the jane is like being in a train car from the 20's. everything is wood and marble, the bathroom, though shared is clean and glamorous. the restaurant downstairs does the room service....and it is incredible food. the vibe is young, hip and boutique. the night club in the lobby is my favorite spot in nyc for having a dance and drink. great dj. the location is 2 blocks from the standard hotel in the meat packing. i love this hotel, truely

Reviews.Title: “Just loved the classiness and historic aspects”
Reviews.Author: Alice N
Reviews.Content: We were planning a trip to 3 cities in the states, and since we are students, we were looking for the cheapest and best-value accommodations (that wasn't a hostel). When I landed on the Jane through Expedia, I couldn't have asked for more... great price, PLUS trendy location (Chelsea District), and the area is quiet in the evenings. To get from place to place, we took the subway from 14th Street most of the time, which is about a 10-15 min walk away. I love the area as it isn't hustle-bustle like Times Square, but it's not eerily quiet with lots of homeless people and sketchy-looking people. Walking in the evenings wasn't scary for us at all. Although I was expecting a very small room, I was still very shocked to find our room to be so narrow and tiny! We got one room with a bunk-bed for the two of us. With our 2 suitcases on the floor, it was near impossible for both of us to stand on the floor at the same time, and we are both very skinny. I kept wondering how people who are bigger than us would manage such a small room. But all in all, we didn't mind the space so much as we knew that we wouldn't be spending any time in there except for sleeping - you don't go to NY to spend time in your hotel room. Although I was a bit nervous about having to use a shared washroom (unisex), I actually wasn't bothered at all...as they maintained their bathrooms/showers/sink area very nicely...with no lingering odours or anything. I particularly appreciated the amazing view of the city across the river from the bathroom window! Brushing my teeth as I was gazing out of the window was a great end to a busy day in the city! All in all, if you don't mind the very small room space, but want to stay at a hip and trendy hotel, this hotel would be great for you.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance - and not even that stylish”
Reviews.Author: holiday26
Reviews.Content: I booked a bunk bed room, knowing it would be small but thinking the hotel's location and stylish decor would make up. I have to say - I am too old for this place!! And I am only (?!) 30!! The room was TINY as stated - and very hot. You could hear your neighbours every move/ word. And the worst part was you could hear the music from the bar - which went on each night till 4am. So I got no sleep what so ever. This is a great hotel if you want to be out till 4am partying. The location was fantastic. But it is not for someone looking for a boutique hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great for NYC on a budget - you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: jrthomas27
Reviews.Content: 1. Room - there are no illusions that the room is small. There were not really any surprises. Furnishings were fine. Clean. My AC was noisy but powerful. One tip is to remove the rod attached to your keys for the electicity, so you are able to run the AC when you are out in the day, to enable you to not run it at night. 2. Shared bathrooms - overall good. Clean were not busy. Sometimes pools of water in front of the showers but not a major problem with the slippers provided. On my last morning someone had pooed in one of the showers which was horrible!! I think this was a freak incident though and I saw it being thoroughly cleaned afterwards. 3. Staff - FANTASTIC!! Reception were incredibly helpful. Quite busy but willing to make time to go out of their way to help you. Bell boys were lovely, very quick to help and make you feel at home. 4. Hotel cafe - overpriced and slightly pretencious french menu. Very pretty inside though and the staff were gorgeous. 5. Noise- very quiet because the hotel was not busy. I can imagine it would be hell if you were next door to a noisy person using their door a lot though, as you can hear quite a lot. 6. Residents at the hotel - possibly the least desirable aspect of the hotel. Being a young woman by myself I felt a little uneasy around them as they were all a bit eccentric and mostly men. Some said hi, most just passed by. They were ok. They had a good relationship with the staff which was reassuring. 7. Location - good. Lots of pretty restaurants and shops near by. Subway close. Nice walk up 8th av into uptown manhattan if you fancy it. Area felt safe at night walking by myself sticking to the main roads, less ok on the residential but fine. Overall stay was good. I got what I wanted - a cheap, convenient, clean place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not interesting if you have a personality”
Reviews.Author: MasterMGH
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Tuesday night after people had told me it would be busy. The decor is lovely but the atmosphere is so very stale. I questioned the hostess about how quiet it was and she claimed it was because the http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_Seismic_Zone earthquake had scared people away. I said, you have to be kidding! I could understand if the only drawcard to this place is the celebrities who come here. I assume most customers are too bored to notice them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: george9595
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jane Hotel last weekend in Manhattan. The bellhops met me at the curb and helped me with my bags, and the check-in staff was great, and even let me into my room a few hours early. When I got up to the room (the elevator is a bit slow) I admit I was shocked at how small it was. But then once I realized that I would be in this room for a few shorts hours each day (from about 3am to 9am) I figured who cares how small it is. It still had A/C, a tv, a bed, some shelves, a bathrobe, slippers, a huge mirror, and drawers. The bathroom down the hall was constantly being cleaned, and best of all, the showers and toilets had complete privacy behind a locking door. The bar on the first floor was a wild scene every night, but up on the 5th floor I wouldn't even know it was there. I liked that they also brought me free water and ice every night when I got back to the hotel. I will definitely be back here next time I'm in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, good value, small, but be aware of what you are getting”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTO
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Jane, and here are some tips for you should you decide to stay at this very reasonable and pleasant hotel: 1) The bed: it is not only a single bed (for those going solo), it is against a wall. This means even less manoeuvring. Here's a tip: swivel the mattress 180 degress. Why? The lip of the mattress has likely been compressed and as a result the mattress "angles" toward the edge. With the more stable lip of the mattress that has been facing the wall now turned to the bed's edge, you won't angle off toward the edge. AND you can then move the mattress about a handwith away from the wall without fear of falling over as that stable lip doesn't hand down. This made all the difference in the world for my sleeping, that little bit of extra room. 2) Quiet: I've read some reviews talking about noise. I had a room on the 6th floor. Perfectly quiet. Great a/c. 3) Showers: the washrooms are very clean, and they give you poly/cotton slippers. What you really need are cheap rubber/plastic slip-ons or flip-flops, as you would with any public shower/bathroom. Spend the $2 to pick up a pair at your local dollar store. 4) The restaurant: gross. Overpriced (like any hotel resto, granted) but unbearably bad faux-french cuisine. There are better places around the corner. Otherwise, the staff is great and the place is compact and clean. If you are not the type who is often in your room, then the value and location are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: carolmonsantos
Reviews.Content: For the second time visiting NYC, I stayed at the Jane for 4 WEEKS! Yes, you read me right. A full month. As you can imagine, I really got to know the hotel, its pros and cons. And I can tell you it was just great. The vibe of the hotel is super cool, with really nice decoration, it feels very comfortable. I had breakfast at the hotel's bar Gitane almost everyday and it was great, not only a cool place with a great vibe, cool music and decoration, but also great food at an affordable price. I also had lunch and dinner a couple of times there and it was really good. Tip: do try the cous-cous (great!) and be careful with the meatballs, they are very spicy! The service at the bar was perfectly normal and within a few days people got to know me and were really extremely nice to me. I have no complaints about it. Regarding the room, I stayed at a Captains Cabin and I really liked it. Of course it's not a big room, but it was definitely big enough for me and my boyfriend, who stayed with me for a couple of weeks. I even had to work almost every day and the desk provided had enough room for everything. The AC worked properly every day, which was convenient since the temperatures in June were around 100.F (something like 42.ÂºC). My room had a view of the river and on two different nights I watched the fireworks from my room, which was amazing! The window are not too big, though. I still liked it. The bathroom was great, and the cleaning service was ok, although I would have to ask to get fresh sheets, because after 2 weeks they didn't change them. When I asked for fresh ones, the immediately changed them, so no problem there either. Everyday they get you a bottle with fresh water (for free), which is a nice touch, as well as the robe and the flip.flops. The wi.fi works great and there were only two ot three times when the servers were down but that only lasted some minutes, and they would get it starting back right away. It was fast and easy to connect. I really liked the hotel staff, who were all very chilled, very nice and helpful and after a whole month they actually started to feel as friends. The location of the hotel is absolutely amazing. It's next to the Meatpacking District (literally 5 minutes walking) and 15 minutes from a subway. It's a very peaceful neighbourhood, with a fresh breeze from the river. I really, really loved the spot. I had a great time and I look forward to return!!! Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Affordable. An great base in New York!”
Reviews.Author: Orangetango44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights at the end of May. One night was spent in a twin(bunk) room with a friend and three were spent in a single. As a bit of a design obsessive I prefer hotels with a bit of character over more clinical/plain hotels, which is why I chose The Jane. Im so glad that I did! The hotel is close to the Metro, about a 5 minute walk, and in the centre of what I was later found is quite a trendy district which includes the High Line. I found the staff at the hotel to be very welcoming, helpful and chatty. Their uniforms are quite special! But they seemed to be enjoying themselves in this quirky enviroment. The rooms are small, but I dont see this as a bad thing and it certainly didnt put me off, the wall to wall mirrors and nice interior design make it seem bigger than it is. The bathrooms are spotless and again, great design! Very vintage. I ordered food one evening (Brie with apple and meatballs) which were both very nice if not a little cold. It was late on an evening and I think the staff were busy with other customers in the cafe so it took a while, I guess this is no excuse but the food still tasted great! The bar is great aswell but the drinks are very expensive, me and my friend had one then went elsewhere.
