We also tried to move from the bar to the main seating area and were told we couldnt as the waitresses hadnt served us. As a british pub-goer I found this annoying as the big sofa's were calling me! The hotel bar is a popular bar in the area for none patrons, which means at a weekend it gets packed and alot of the partiers hang out outside. This wasnt so pleasant when I had to get my flight at 3am (kicking out time) when I was surrounded by drunk hipsters (ugh). However the staff had me as a priority and made sure everyone got out of the way when my airport transfer arrived. All in all though I will definately be staying at The Jane the next time I hit NY and will be recommending it to any visiting friends. Cheap, individual and chilled. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool, but very small.”
Reviews.Author: secled
Reviews.Content: Best deal in town; if you can deal with the tiny room. Staff was very friendly and courteous. Rooms were nicely appointed with the barest of necessities. Room was extremely small with very little room to move around. A person 6 feet tall or more may find this space and bed to be unacceptable. Be prepared to improvise. On premise restaurant and disco. You might not want a room near the discotheque on weekends. Shared bath options. Excellent location in west village with convenient taxi service. Can't beat the price. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very small room.”
Reviews.Author: LESLEY_ANNScotland
Reviews.Content: We loved the location,we used the 'free bikes' outside and cycled round Manhattan.Great cycle route across the road from the hotel where you can cycle up the Hudson. I found the staff to be very helpful. We were a bit shocked when we first arrived in the room, it is awful small. Although cozy, we did look at each other and laugh. We stayed for a week and had no problems. The shared bathroom was okay,although on our first morning we were met by a man leaning over the sink brushing his teeth with only his boxer shorts on.They supply robes and slippers which I assumed everyone would wear.or not! This only happened once and anytime I went to shower there was always one available. There is 2 bathrooms on every floor (which is a total of 4 toilets and 4 showers) which I found to be clean. There appears to be full time residents staying and they insist on leaving their door ajar with a robe over it.odd.they also had the television on a bit too loud for my liking. All in all,cheap for New York, the nearest subway is 14th Steet at 8th ave. Nice walk through Meatpacking District. The wonderful "Pastis" is a few blocks from the hotel.Great. Give the JANE a shot,so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage chic on a budget”
Reviews.Author: RaymondTobias
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jane for a week in July 2011, and loved every minute of it. The hotel has a great location, and i mostly walked everywhere I wanted to get to. Sure the rooms are tiny, but they are cute as a button. The bathrooms are shared, but they are spacious and spotless. The whole hotel is beautifully decorated in vintage style. The bar was fun, the restaurant served delicious food, and all of the staff were wonderful. I am certainly coming back in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, totally rude staff and unacceptable practices”
Reviews.Author: jrocha63
Reviews.Content: Overall the rooms are clean and have not experienced problems I paid for a captain's room with a king bed. The thing that is unacceptable is when arriving back from a evening out I noticed the Jane Ballroom was open and thought I would check it out and maybe grab a night cap before bed. I walked up and I see them letting in several other people into the lounge and when I attempted to enter series of rude people running the door and a particularly rude tall woman said the lounge was closed for a "private event". No sign, no "list" nothing... I indicated I was a hotel guest but all that got was rolling eyes. Based on that treatment and the overall disregard for their guests I recommend not staying here, ever! I certainly wont and I travel to NYC over 30 times a year. I'll go beck to the LES hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good 'ole Plain Jane”
Reviews.Author: Marcil1
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Jane two years after my first visit. (In reference to other recent reviews, I saw no sign of any bugs in 4 days.) The Jane's rooms are small. The A/C was somewhat noisy but workable. My in-room phone seemed uncooperative. The shared bathrooms/showers are impeccable. The restaurant on the ground floor (not open during my last visit) has a great granola/fruit/yoghurt breakfast. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The neighborhood is quiet and relaxed. (I never heard any noise from the downstairs club in my room.) A decent (10-minute) hike to the 14thSt/8th Av. subway. There is no reason to spend any time in the Jane, but if a room is all you need during a NY visit, the location and the price make it attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Trading convenience for price...”
Reviews.Author: milepost99_99
Reviews.Content: I rated The Jane as "very good" because for what they provide, they do a good job of delivering. Located off West Street, hard on the Hudson River, the building is 100 years old and apparently was originally a place for merchant sailors to get a room between voyages. The rooms are basically tiny cabins probably 6' wide and 10' deep. built-in bed is cot-width but was comfortable. A/C and wall mounted fan keep the room comfortable. Small window for the claustrophobics. Flat screen TV. Lots of closet space (just kidding). Bathroom is down the hall with fully enclosed johns and showers. If you need an inexpensive place to sleep, or are looking for a quirky adventure in NY, this may be the place. Their website accurately represents what they deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous per usual!”
Reviews.Author: mollykrichard
Reviews.Content: I have been a big fan of the Jane since it opened in 2008 (I think). I have stayed here three times - once in March of 2009, Once in March of 2010 and I just got home from my second stay in July of 2011. What I was kind of peeved about is that the Jane no longer allows couples to split single rooms (and while this is annoying, its a great way to save money). My boyfriend and I stayed in a double bunk bed room. Each bunk had its own TV, and the room had an ipod dock. I was SUPER paranoid about bed bugs before we came, but a quick inspection upon arrival showed nothing. I cannot imagine that the Jane is turning a blind eye to the bed bug epidemic in New York, especially with all of the bed press they seem to be getting these days. Our stay was very comfortable. Yes, the rooms are small, yes, the hotel is noisy with the hopin' bar down below. But it is still a great deal in New York. The only complaint I really have is the patrons of the bar on the weekends. They are annoying pretentious asswipes who like to yell at people in taxis to get out so they can go home and think about the night's bad decisions. But, you know. My boyfriend did have breakfast at Cafe Gitante on Friday morning which was a breeze to be seated. Every time I passed the cafe on Saturday and Sunday, though, it was mobbed. The cafe was tasty. I had a baked egg salmon thing that was lovely. It was a little small for 7 bucks. But if you dont dig it, there is a multitude of other places around the area. Especially little coffee shops. The Jane was lovely. Service was lovely. I appreciate the great value as always~

Reviews.Title: “Train cabin”
Reviews.Author: Cph30
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my owne for two nights, in a single room with shared bath room. It's really like a train cabin 2,5x3meters nothing more. So if you are there for more than two nights book something bigget. The location is great and the staff friendly and helpful, but I would recomend them to give Info about The hotel on check in -I didn't discover the bar before i had checked out. All in all a cool place and they are at the moment building a roof theres which should be really cool:)

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan on a Budget, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: voyagenow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location & is great if you want to stay in Manhattan on a budget. I stayed at the hotel for a couple of nights before I took my first ever cruise & I loved it. The rooms resemble a ships cabin (although the cabin I had on my cruise was much bigger, lol). The room I stayed in was the size of a queen size bed, literally. But it had everything I needed. Air conditioning, flat screen TV, radio, even a bathrobe & slippers which came in handy because the bathrooms were shared. The bathrooms are kept very clean & the showers & toilets are in individual locked stalls. The restaurant & bar on site are excellent. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They even have one of those old elevators with a pill box capped operator manning it. As a solo traveller I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome NYC Base”
Reviews.Author: JM_travels_sometimes
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at The Jane...so much so that I'll be going back for a few extra days this week. It has a charm and a style that is all it's own. Fantastic area - close to the subway with easy access to everything NYC has to offer, resturants, bars and stores. Staff were helpful and unintrusive. Everything is clean and well cared for. Yes the rooms are teeny tiny - but you know that when your booking so no complaints from me. Great place for a decent price - though don't forget about the tax on top of the charge....it can surprise you at check out! I think the cafe is a little pricy - but it's a great space (with Vegemite Toast on the menu for those seeking the best hangover cure on earth!) and the service is hit and miss. The bar is also a great space but a little on the pricey side - better off heading for any one of the bars within walking distance. Avoid the convinience store around the corner (Nonno?) - it's really expensive!

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd time at The Jane, and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: SteveStefan
Reviews.Content: Yet again, I had an excellent time at The Jane. The location is perfect, the staff are friendly, and they have a new lift! YAY!!! The bathrooms, although shared are very clean and spacious. The rooms are tiny, but why would you spend your time indoors when the world (NYC) is just outside, ready to explore?

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier.”
Reviews.Author: NC1313
Reviews.Content: What a remarkable little hotel. Friendly staff, great restaurant, eco friendly bathrooms and energy. I was just delighted to be in a place that used space wisely without skimping on comfort. If you've stayed on a boat, you'll think these rooms are enormous and well fitted. If you're used to space, this my be a shock. The single bed was immensely comfortable. I stayed for a weeks and had plenty of storage space. Being a basketball fan and staying there during the playoffs, I was incredibly thankful for the flat screen and cable in my room with free WiFi. The elevtor broke a couple times while I was there and being on the 5th floor it was a pain, but not a trip killer. The subway is about a half mile walk, but lovely in the spring and I got to pass my favorite soap shop each time (Soapology). You're right on the river if you want to go for a run and the resturant's salmon pot pie was just KILLER. So good. Honestly, I felt like I might not have been cool enough for this place with all the hipsters running around, but I will be back. The service, the rooms, the locale, you can't beat it. Read up on the history of the place as well. They hosted the Titanic survivors for crying out loud! So cool.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a little gem - I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: AntMontrose
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Jane for the second time. My first trip was 2 years ago. This most recent stay was for 11 nights and it worked out perfectly. The location is superb and I doubt you could find a better deal anywhere in New York City. The moment you walk up the steps and into the spacious, cool lobby, you know youâ€™re somewhere a bit special. The hotel staff members are pleasant, helpful and willing to go the extra mile â€“ for example storing your luggage. The bathrooms at the end of each corridor are spotlessly clean. I never experienced a queue and the cabins are cosy and great for a place to lay your head and sleep soundly. Theyâ€™re also very well designed, with lots of space to store things. I also found them (I had one at the back of the hotel) very quiet. The wifi is exceptional. No password - just get straight on. When I stayed at the Jane first, there was no cafe or bar. The two additions are great â€“ very cool and well thought through. If youâ€™re looking for somewhere with the perfect location, spotlessly clean, comfortable and with an air of fun about it â€“ Iâ€™d thoroughly recommend the Jane. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Jane”
Reviews.Author: Nessnpete
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to everything. Cafe Gitane made the best coffee I had in NYC and also loved the dinners we had there. We stayed in one of the fantastic captain's cabins and will definitely be back. Excellent and friendly staff on the desk and at the doors. This is the kind of hotel where the staff are great to chat to and they create a relaxed vibe. Room was always clean despite us staying for 10 days and therefore accumulating a lot of stuff. A hiccup at check out was a little painful to deal with and a simple task was complicated but all in all it was inconsequential.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: wanderingsam
Reviews.Content: wow! this place was a surprise. the bad - very small rooms (ie. like staying on a small yacht). BUT, so cool - retro feel - extraordinary layout/design/decor. never seen anything like it before. and in a really cool part of NY city - you'll be close to everything. i was traveling alone so i'm not sure how you'd go as a couple given the rooms are so tiny. i probably wouldn't recommend it for that. also, don't go to cafe gitane - it's very crap, but the hotel can't be blamed for that. price very reasonable. recommended, if for the experience alone.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place for a solo traveler!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirl98
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic and I have no complaints. The staff are friendly, the location is great (a bit far from the train but a nice walk) and the rooms are cute. Yes they're small, but you shouldn't be spending that much time in them anyway. The beds are comfy and the A/C and wireless works great. The shared bathrooms are clean and I never had to wait to shower or pee! I got a sweet deal on Hotels.com and the Jane is somewhere I'll return to.

Reviews.Title: “Think upscale dorm room & terrific location...”
Reviews.Author: alamo-smith
Reviews.Content: Once you are over the initial shock (& I mean shock!) re. how TINY the room is (think sleeper car on the train) & that you are sharing 2 toilets & 2 showers with an entire floor of people..... you can appreciate the good qualities... great location only a few minutes walk from the High Line Park (fabulous urban park created on abandoned elevated railway track), Chelsea Market (superb bakeries & diner in converted warehouse), 14 St subway, Hudson River & a great selection of bistros, eateries, late night wine spots. The hotel staff were very friendly, the bunks comfortable & we never had to wait for the facilities! We may well return!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quirky, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: JMC1032
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week and got a full dose of Jane. The rooms are small, but well designed, fitted out, and comfortable. I stayed in a single, with a shared bath, on the 5th floor. It was immaculate, and I asked for maid service each day. Though the room was non-smoking, the floor was not and there were smokers in at least two rooms on the floor. Not all rooms are hotel rooms apparently, some are residential and te one across from me had his/her door always ajar - odd but not creepy. Bath rooms were always available, no waiting, but toilets were not always clean; great showers. Wifi was Winky on my iPad, worked well on my iPhone. Just a few easy blocks to 14th Street Subway. Odd to use the key chain to power the room, but effective.

Reviews.Title: “No plain Jane”
Reviews.Author: jonpost
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a find. I'm staying in one of the singles for $99, repeat $99, and it is amazing. The rooms are smaller than you could believe possible - about 35 square feet - but spotlessly clean, characterful and comfortable; the cafe/ brasserie downstairs is excellent; the hotel club/ bar is very funky indeed; you're in the meatpacking district overlooking the Hudson and minutes from the West Village; bike rental is free; oh and did I mention it's $99? Jane, what a girl. Am now off to boring corporate hotel for offsite at $450/ night and already looking forward to coming back here Thursday.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linzsay
Reviews.Content: This hotel has bedbugs, I was bitten fairly severely. Check out the NYC bed bug register for more details and many more reports. It's a shame as it's a nice place with friendly staff and a nice cafe.

Reviews.Title: “okay for a one night stand, if you have to”
Reviews.Author: pavlovsdawg
Reviews.Content: I loved the Bowery and also the Maritime and I was excited to stay here. I stayed in a Captain's room. It was a profound disappointment. There were quite a few things I didn't like: - The window to the room are prison sized - The mattress is uncomfortable - The power off thing makes it very uncomfortable in the room on a hot day. - The housekeeping staff gave me 2 shampoos but no shower gel. When I asked for that to be fixed I was brought up 2 conditioners. okay.... - The TV signal seemed really off. Not that I spend much time watching TV in NY but it was kind of annoying. - The bar downstairs was 'closed for a private party'. Apparently this happens often. Also there aren't always cabs outside as the hotel is pretty out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for solo female travelers!”
Reviews.Author: loosek
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 13 nights in May 2011 on my first ever solo trip. Was initially very apprehensive about safety to New York and wanted a convenient, safe, and well priced accommodation. The Jane fitted the bill perfectly! The locality is in the charming and safe West Village, and I felt safe walking alone at 10.30pm from the subway to the hotel. And in fact, at 3am from the nearby Meatpacking district after a night out in town. Subway is located a mere 10minute walk at 8th and 14th, and the walk is perfect for scoping out nice local cafes. The subway gets you to everywhere in Manhattan easily. The trendy clubbing/pub area of Meatpacking district is literally 5 minutes walk from hotel, which is awesome for the high heels and alcohol-wobbles :P I stayed on level 4. Room is small but comfortable for one person with plenty of space for luggage. Serviced everyday and love the bathrobe and slippers provided. No in-room fridge but bottle water provided in a cute jug everyday. Lots of electronic amenities provided, but the free Wi-Fi is definitely the draw card, being fast and reliable! Room has a fan and aircon although these tend to be rather noisy. Free local calls are available from the in-room phone, and this was soo handy for ordering all the (free! new york is amazing) dinner deliveries straight to my room! Shared bathrooms are generally clean, with shampoo, conditioner and shower gel provided. There is hardly ever a queue, and if there is, it's always a short wait. I loved the view of statue of liberty greeting me every morning from the bathroom! Hair dryer is available in the bathroom. The 24 hour staff are all so friendly and helpful. One of the front desk girls even came out clubbing with myself and another girl staying at the hotel! Hotel's cafe is cute in decor but I thought the food was only average. I didn't have the chance to go to the hotel bar, but I heard that it has a nice vibe, although often hired out for private functions. Try to get a room on a higher level so you won't be disturbed by the music from the bar late at night. Only complaints: There are some permanent residents there, and consequently, some of them will smoke in their rooms. On 2 of the 13 nights I stayed, even though my room door was closed, I was nearly choking with the cigarette smoke and had a terrible night's sleep. When I told the front desk, unfortunately they advised me that not much could be done except for the housekeeping staff to air out my room :( It was just lucky that I encountered this problem for only 2 nights, otherwise I would've asked to change rooms. Other complaint is that the walls/doors are not too soundproof so you will hear the neighbour's tv occasionally, and the drunken giggles of people storming down the corridor after returning from late night clubbing. I didn't find it too much of a problem though. Overall: love the decor, history and vibe of the hotel. Friendly and helpful staff overall. Cheapest hotel in a convenient, and safe location in Manhattan. Free reliable wifi. Also, the tv program "how to make it in America" was shooting on location at the hotel on one of the days!

Reviews.Title: “Jane is a charming girl”
Reviews.Author: Chiorazzi
Reviews.Content: The character of this hotel is undeniable. A welcome change from the cookie cutter places out there. Loved the uniformed staff and the ambience. I appreciated my single bed very close to the bathroom and with a view of the Hudson. Drawback though was the "jet engine" hair dryers they use in the bathrooms. They can clearly be heard all night long as people dry their hands. Paper towels anyone ? Seems it would eliminate this problem not to mention keep in character with the hotel. Dimmers on the lights (nice touch). Appreciated the fan option and the hooks very smart. It was not clear the water was free. Didn't find out till now. A note would have been appreciated. Discovered bikes were free after I left also.

Reviews.Title: “cosy and budget, but excellent location and ambience”
Reviews.Author: katherinet1982
Reviews.Content: Tiny cabin room, but perfectly formed and retro - really looks like a ship's cabin. Very comfortable bed. Quite noisy aircon if staying in humid summer and need to have it on. Right in the heart of meatpacking district on safe street. View of Statue of Liberty from bathroom. Stunning and authentic hallway. Shared bathroom with lots of people - don't know if would have been a wait if using at peak times Some rooms rented by long-stayers dating back to when it was a YMCA, but didn't realise til was told. Adds to the atmosphere. Very helpful front desk staff 24/7 - keeping baggage stored for extra days, recommending bars, taxi spots, internet locations, helping with phone use

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Fun, Clean and Quirky!!”
Reviews.Author: nicoledSeattleWA
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Jane and it's now the only NYC hotel for me. I don't mind a shared bath and the bunk bed rooms are tiny(see more about Captains room below), but it's perfect for a solo traveler especially one that has far more planned in NYC than being in a hotel room. The bathrooms are cleaned 24/7. The rooms are pristine. The staff really takes care of the hotel. Free bottled water, free wifi, crisp cotton robes, plentiful towels and slippers in every room. No closet, but plenty of hooks on walls and door and drawers under the bed. I wonder if the bellhop would store your empty suitcase for you to keep it out of the way? It'd be worth asking as the staff is sooooo accommodating. Did I mention free bike rentals? With the trail up and down the Hudson right across the street, this a perfect place to bike to and from. Cafe gitane is on the ground floor. They have wonderful food, coffee to go and a large sunny room in which to lounge and graze. The bar is dark and sexy and a perfect spot for meeting friends. The decor is quirky. Funky taxidermy, glossy tile, dark woods and a high ceilinged lobby. There is gorgeous wall paper in the rooms. Cannot say enough about the staff - they are friendly, warm, responsive, helpful and nice. NOTE: NYC went through a few months of bed bug infestation awhile back and no hotel was spared - from budget hotels to the Waldorf Astoria. The Jane takes this very seriously. They clean, clean, clean to keep bed bugs from getting in. IF you have a problem with bed bugs at the Jane (I had no problem on either trip), the Jane has a procedure for ridding your rooms and belongings of bed bugs. Everyone at the hotel is trained to act immediately should you have a problem here. I merely inquired about it and was immediately reassured. The only way to fight bed bugs is to be diligent and quick and it's obvious that the Jane does it well. I hated to leave the Jane on Thursday. Captains Rooms: On my last stay (May 2010), I upgraded myself from bunk room to Captains room because I had some friends stopping by to visit. Captains rooms are lush. Funky, comfy furniture, Hudson Rive views and great bath products in the huge en suite bath. There is a big armoire for storage and a small fridge. I had three friends in for wine and snacks before going out and it was very comfortable. This room would be the *perfect* romantic spot for a weekend getaway with the one you love.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I stayed there”
Reviews.Author: natralatraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Jane for three nights in mid April in one of the Captain's Cabins. It was a lovely corner room and although long and skiny there was plently of room. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and the shower was fabulous. We has a nice view of the river however, it was over the freeway. It was a little noisy but hey - its NYC - so what's a little noise!. The location was great. Close to most of the subway lines and within walking distance to lots of amazing restaurants and things to see and do. My one complaint was that there was only a thin quilt over the sheets on the bed. Although the room was warm and the bed was comfortable (although a little hard) it did feel strange to not have a nice fluffy "doona". The quilt was more like a bedspreed and was not very soft or inviting. There is a lovely little restaurant to the side of the lobby and although the menu is not extensive everything I sampled was delicious. And they had VEGEMITE! Very impressive for a restaurant outside of Australia. I would definitely recomment the hotel to a friend but I would probably not stay there again as I like to vary where I stay so that I can experience lots of different places.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay when you're in town.”
Reviews.Author: kenl3
Reviews.Content: What a find ! From the moment you enter, you're in for a pleasant stay. The staff couldn't be more service oriented. Don't expect posh surroundings. Do expect a VERY clean room, bathroom down the hall, etc. Even when the elevator isn't working, it's like "you're in New York, get over it." Ask to stay on one of the upper floors if noise is an issue. I don't know what the deal is with the Jane Ballroom, but don't expect to be let in, I guess unless you're young and beautiful. One block east and one block to the right is Tortilla Flats. You can't find a restaurant with more character than this one. Every time I've stayed at The Jane, it's been a pleasant experience. And if it's 3AM and you can't sleep, chat up the desk clerk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: dewdneyk
Reviews.Content: Great budget hotel that was immaculately clean and I had no problems with the shared bathroom facilities which were really well looked after and never any queues. Staff were very friendly - really good tips on where to buy great value electronic goods saved me lots. Cafe next door was lovely for breakfast and I regret I wasn't here long enough to try it for dinner. Rooms are small but there's room for storage and bed was very comfortable. Fan did not keep me awake so was cool enough in lovely weather. I would definitely stay here again as it's location is fantastic. Right over the road from the Hudson River Park, 5 minutes walk to subway and easy access to everywhere - you can take the A train right from JFK to the nearest subway without having to change lines so transfers are also easy and cheap (no taxis necessary). View of the Statue of Liberty from bathroom as I brushed my teeth - you really know you're in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Full of character”
Reviews.Author: apontamento
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jane with a friend for 2 weeks and we already knew the rooms were small and we had to share a bathroom so we weren't expecting nothing fancy, just a place to sleep and take a bath. We asked for a room on the upper floors when we made the reservation (to avoid the noise) and they gave us one. And there were absolutely no bed bugs. We were on a budget on this trip and it seemed like the perfect hotel for what we could afford. We really liked it and the staff was nice. One of the guys at the front desk even spoke a little Portuguese with us every time we saw him. We had breakfast once in their restaurant and it was delicious! There were 2 bathrooms on our floor (with 2 baths each) and we never had to wait to take a shower and it was always clean. On one of the bathrooms we could even see the Statue of Liberty through the window. That was neat! I would definitely stay at The Jane again.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: caf06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cute on arrival but that is where the fun ends. I could have lived with the tiny cabin room if it was not for the noise of a disco til 4 am. We complained on 5 occasions but alas this made no difference. In the morning we found cockroaches in our room. The bathrooms were clean, but after several showers in the morning, the floor was flooded and covered in bits of hair. We were offered 20% discount, but after some pressure had a complete refund. Seriously folks AVOID this place if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky little hotel - great location, great bar, great cafe, but very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: xjgrl
Reviews.Content: My mom and I had a wonderful stay @ The Jane. We really enjoyed the quirky atmosphere of the hotel and had a great time at the bar and Cafe Gitane. We stayed in a bunk bed room with shared bath. The only down side to our stay was not being able to get ready or "hang out" in the room at the same time -- the room was too small. And, also, there was some "weird" stuff going on in the shared coed bathroom at one point -- an older gentleman seemingly making tuna fish? Hmmmm. Odd. The bathrooms were clean overall, but I definitely wish they had provided us with waterproof shower shoes rather than cotton slippers. The robes also could have been a bit bigger/longer since we had to walk thru the halls in them. But, that being said, we really enjoyed The Jane and I would be inclined to stay there again -- especially if I was traveling solo. The rooms are affordable and the bar was great fun -- awesome, albeit expensive, drinks -- but really cool atmosphere! Cafe Gitane was also spectacular! Definitely "borrow" some bikes when you visit -- take a ride down the river trail. Great fun!

Reviews.Title: “What it dont have in size, it have in atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: Spoock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great way for a traveller with a limited budget to live in near-center New York. The staff is great and even though you have to deal with shared toilets and baths in the halls, I never experienced waiting time - even though I think the hotel was fully booked due to easter. I would recommend the hotel for everyone visiting New York on a budget...

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Friendly Staff, Perfect for One”
Reviews.Author: fuzzpop
Reviews.Content: The Jane suited me perfectly. All I wanted was a room to crash and store my shopping as I wasn't planning to spend a lot of time in my room. It was tiny but plenty of storage which was designed creatively. Cafe Gitane downstairs served fabulous food and the citron presse was DELICIOUS! Each time I left and returned, I was greeted with in a friendly manner and on the whole, I was extremely pleased with my stay. Will I return? Hell, yes! I read some of the negative comments but I honestly think the reviewer's expectations may have been somewhat unrealistic. That said, my friend arrived and had to book the Captain's room as the hotel was fully booked. I found it roomy and spacious, with a fantastic view. The air-conditioning worked and the room was truly well-lit. Not sure if the reviewer was simply being somewhat "high-maintainence" .

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this one!”
Reviews.Author: DMCManchester
Reviews.Content: There are about a dozen cement steps up into the ornate, lovely front entrance to The Jane. There was a doorman / bellman standing on the sidewalk talking to a young man on a bike as I approached with my suitcase. He watched as I lugged the suitcase up the stairs, struggled with the heavy wooden door and tripped into the hotel. There's a reason for the training that "service personnel" are offered at "traditional" hotels! This hotel is definitely for the edgy, adventurous, bored-with-the-usual and possibly younger traveler. It is "funky" which translates to dark, battered and small. I stayed in a rather expensive "captain's room" - which had its own bath (as opposed to shared bath facilities in smaller rooms). The room lacked air conditioning - ugh! - so the opened (small) window provided some muggy circulation and lots of street noise. The room was very dark, there were slippers provided which pleased me because the dark carpet was both worn and dingy enough to be scary. The two small chairs were stiff and uncomfortable and the drain in the tub didn't work. There is an attached, very brightly lit, tile floored restaurant - not great decor but the food was very, very good. So there's a bright spot. The only one -

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Make sure you call to confirm you room is not adjacent to a stairwell or your better off on the street. Also.....BED BUG”
Reviews.Author: sps3arch
Reviews.Content: Won't be back, manager refused to see me, and told the desk staff that I should write him an email addressing my concerns... whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel, great location, affordable, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Samella
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel due to friends being in the area and the affordability. The bunk rooms are compact but if like us, you won't be spending too much time in your room. The hotel is about a 10-15 min walk to get to the nearest subway at West 14th but the route is pleasant via nice shops, restaurants, bars and sights of Meat Packing District (alternatively a $5 taxi away). Otherwise walks to Broadway, downtown, uptown via Greenwich, Chelsea etc are nice too, with lots to see on the way. High Lines and lively bars nearby make it ideal for getting back from a day out and heading out for dinner again (The Diner on West 14th highly recommended for late night feasts). The shared bathroom was not a problem for us - our main requirement was affordability, cleanliness, relaxed atmosphere, and no bed bugs! The Jane delivered on all this, together with a nice cafe attached, and a bar for those who's budget could extend. We weren't around for a film night on the Monday, but a great idea for those who need a break from the bright lights and big city. The bar is quite popular and whilst we weren't there Fri or Sat, imagine it would be quite lively. The added touches like the safe, dressing gowns, slippers, water bottles, nice furniture, slick bathroom tiling and fab showers, which were spotless, all added to a great experience for us. The ambient temperature of the room was on the slightly too warm side, with a trade off being open windows and street noise, but presumably as we were there in autumn, the central heating hadn't been turned down just yet.

Reviews.Title: “The Jane Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: lewandowski
Reviews.Content: Let's face it..,,the Jane is not for everyone!! When I read some of the FEW negative reviews ,,,,, I wonder what these people exactly had in my mind when they book their rooms.., did they not do a little research??...Maybe the cheap Manhattan price sucked them in.... Well let me tell you,,,,, I paid $90 for a closet of room, so tiny,,,,,AND I loved every minute of it..The Jane Rocks!! Yes,,, I had to share a bathroom, and sleep in very small quarters,,..No problem!!!..Love the atomosphere of this hotel.. The staff were so friendly and helpful..No attitude..Cool!!! Awesome neighborhood!!! Hotel has a ccol history!! If you stay here,,,do a little research,, if it's not for you,, no problem,,,BUT,, if you are like me,, not uptight and up for an adventure.!!!! you will love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: AirDJ
Reviews.Content: The Jane is an experience by itself: like taking the Orient Express train. You will be welcomed and ushered by a groom with full costume. The rooms are tiny, but you know what to expect. It is very clean (and that includes bathroom and restrooms), quiet and there is heaps of storage in this room. It's really like staying in a train. The decor is nice and the staff very friendly: you can see they are happy to work there (the receptionist was doing a happy dance until she realises I was watching her...). The Restaurant is nice, but noisy. Try the couscous. Safe area and about 7 min walk to the metro. Highly recommended for a solo traveller who wants a short stay without spending all your money.

Reviews.Title: “small (but perfectly formed) rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-NZgirl
Reviews.Content: I liked this place. I thought the rooms were cool. Yes, they are small, but they didnt feel too small/claustrophobic at all. Effectively its the size of 2 single beds, with shelving and window at the end of the bed - and above the bed is a big shelf which easily fitted my suitcase (althou there was also room on the floor for the suitcase too). Long mirror with hooks to hang things up on opposite the bed. Theres also an ipod dock and flat screen tv. and the free wifi was fast and reliable. So yes, small but quite quirky and i did feel like i was in a ships berth - which was fun. The bathrooms were fine - black and white tiled and generally pretty clean. I liked the pump dispensers in the shower of shower gel, shampoo and conditioner so dont worry about bringing your own. There was a bar, which i looked into one afternoon and it looked pretty cool. Unfortunately the nights I was there was New York Fashion week and it was booked out for private functions. The staff were pretty helpful though about suggesting when to come down to try and get in, but I couldnt be bothered waiting around that much. I found the staff really good. I arrived at 7am, after about 30 hours of travelling (from NZ) and was pleasantly surprised to be able to check in straight away. I showered and went straight to bed for a few hours. I did however wake up to find bites on my legs. Having read all about the bed bug epidemic in New York I rang the front desk who came straight away. They didnt think it was bed bugs - was about 7 different bites, apparently bed bug bites are clustered in groups of 3 - but they took all my stuff away, heat treated it, gave me anti-itch cream, put the stuff i wanted to wear in the dryer for 30 mins (so could have it quicker than the heat treating) and switched my room. I'm still not sure whether it was bed bugs or not - part of me suspects it was, as the first bed didnt have the protective cover zip up mattress protector that the second room had - but the bites did go away pretty quickly and I've had no other issues. I was impressed by how quickly and efficiently they acted, and almost didnt write this as I dont want to put people off. I think in New York what you really want is a place that responds quickly if there are suspected bed bugs, which is what the Jane did. The first room I was briefly in, was on the 3rd floor - at the end of the hallway. The second room was on the 4th floor, in the middle of the hallway. The end rooms are curved, so slightly smaller and being closer to the bathroom meant that it was noisier. 4th floor was very quiet and no problem with neighbours. Location was great. Easy to walk all around Chelsea, its about 2 mins from the HighLine, easy walking distance to West Village / Greenwich etc as well. Metro was about 5-10 mins away. Lots of bars and clubs in the area, and felt safe to walk around at night. I also spent a few nights in the Theatre District - but if you wanted somewhere close to bars / clubs I'd recommend this area more. And also, seriously, $99 for a hotel in New York? for value for money you'd be hard pressed to beat it. and its a cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, but full of hipster doofuses.”
Reviews.Author: shhs97
Reviews.Content: Not really a critique of the hotel, which I suppose is not fair. The hotel itself was fine. $99 per night on a weekend in NYC, great. Rooms are tiny...I have NO idea how they made them look the size they did in the pics. They are small...but clean. And the communal bathrooms are fine. And contrary to other reviews, the staff was OK. Friendly, semi-helpful...OK. However, 2 points: #1. The guests are the most ridiculous people I have ever been around. How did you folks manage to find each other and book the same hotel? I mean, geeze, I've never seen so many people trying so hard to be different, yet ending up looking and acting EXACTLY the same. #2. We went into the hotel bar during the early hours...nothing special. $9 canned beer and old furniture. Just for fun, to see if we would be turned away, we approach the doormen on Saturday night to get into the hip/coo/mecca. "sorry, it's a private party tonight". Lol, we did not want to get into your sad little "cool" place anyways. BUT...HELLO, you are the cheapest hotel in NYC.....and you don't even let your own guests into the hotel bar? So sad. Of course it is the West village. It used to be full of cool, bohemian, artists, gay/lesbian, POOR folks. Now, $4200 for a 1 bedroom. So, Hotel is OK, just be prepared to be confronted with people who think they are too cool for school. When, in reality, they are probably useless trust-fund babies with no actual use in society.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is Cool”
Reviews.Author: sneakerhound
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. They give you in an addition to towels they have a bathrobe and slippers in the room and bottled water. I don't like sharing bathrooms but this place was nice. Now I did stay in a room that was little short bed because it was on the corner and good thing I am short because anyone else over 5'1" would of felt uncomfortable. I originally had a room on the 6th floor but the elevator was being serviced all weekend. It was ok because I ate one too many fresh buttery croissants and needed the stair workout....LOL Oh they have bikes you can rent all day with a $200 credit card deposit. The French restaurant is nice and the hotel staff friendly especially the bartender's. I will most def will be coming back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: bboi25
Reviews.Content: - There was a smoky smell in the room. They need to start telling people this is a non-smoking facility when they check-in (they didn't say anything to me). - The room was way hot during the day. There's no way to adjust the room temperature manually other than opening the window or turning on the fan. - People next door tend to leave their TV on until 4 or 5 in the morning. You absolutely need ear plugs to be able to sleep. - There is no hair dryer in the room. Only shared bathrooms have hair-dryers. Other hotels with shared bathrooms include a hair-dryer in every room. - There is no sink in the room. You have to go brush your teeth in the shared bathroom. Again, other places with shared bathrooms do have sink in the rooms. - The elevator doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: siren_streak
Reviews.Content: I'll definitely stay at The Jane again next time I'm in New York. Great location - near the river and a subway station just 10 minutes away. Sure, the room was small, but then I'm also small and I travel light. And it was always tidied when I got back at the end of a long day of sightseeing, and the shared bathroom was always spotless. Still dream about the yummy waffels for breakfast! :D The staff were friendly and helpful as well. Only had one bad night sleep-wise due to the noisy couple in the room next door, right up till someone knocked on their door and had a word. :)

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobia”
Reviews.Author: XLhehe
Reviews.Content: Am not a big boy, more a small dude. Am not too demanding. But seriously, despite a nice design and excellent location, I discover I was nearly claustrophobic! The room is so small. But like really small. I could even not open my luggage in it. Other bad point was the cigarette odor in the aircon... Gave me a huge headache... And I am a smoker! Lastly, bad soundproof, super noisy. However, the facilities are good : ipod player, free wifi (that works very well) and nice restaurant. PS: the lift was out of service, had to climb 4 levels of stairs with my heavy as hell luggage... A nice options when you are 20yo or below.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most unique hotels in a city of hotels”
Reviews.Author: erinnl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jane for a little under a week. It was my first trip to NYC and I knew I didn't have a lot of time or money to spare in my short visit, so it was the perfect call. Located in a great neighborhood just a few short blocks walk (not even a hassle despite the cold) from the 8th and 14th station, everything about this place was great. The staff were beyond helpful. I made a rookie traveller mistake in regards to my credit card and they were incredibly patient throughout the entire thing. They helped me with questions when I had them & were always friendly. Yes, the rooms are small. European travellers are used to this sort of thing, it's close to the common size of many rooms overseas. But you're in NYC. The last thing you should be doing is spending your time in your room! The beds are comfortable and the temp was perfect if I just opened my window a tiny crack. I showed up during the big bedbug scare and had no problems whatsoever. My room was clean as were the bathrooms. I'm planning a trip back in a few months. This trip I have a good deal more money to spent, but even after spending time looking at all the other hotel options out there? I think I'm going to stick with the Jane. Maybe get a captain's just to see the difference, but no matter what room I end up in I know I'm getting a great value & unique experience for my dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntanDiyana
Reviews.Content: If I were ever to come to New York again, I would definitely book my stay with The Jane. I solo travelled to NYC for a week and did not have any problem the whole time I stayed there. The room was clean and tidy everytime I came back in the evening. The front desk guy was helpful and service was excellent. It takes less than 10 minutes to reach the nearest subway station and most importantly, it was a safe area for me being a woman solo traveller. The bathroom, although shared, was very clean. They also provided a nice hairdryer, of which I use every single morning. Since I wake early at 6 am , never had to worry about quieing up to use the bathroom. I truly enjoyed my stay there. If you're on a budget, this place provides you with every basic thing you need - ipod dock, tv and a good clean bed. Only complaint - The heater was a little noisy and makes a thumping sound, which can be a lil bit annoying. But hey, for 99 bucks a night - am not complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: niksplace
Reviews.Content: First we arrived there early in the morning and the man at the front desk told us we could check in early since they were slow (that should have been our 1st clue) for FREE. Their elevators were out for repairs so we had to carry our bags up the stairs and one of the men that worked there actually broke my collegue's bag. Then we get into our room the bunk bed room, which we knew was small but it was just too tiny for 2 people, but the worst part was the smell that was in the hotel, it was just unbearable and hard to describe. Due to the small room and the fact that we were going to be there for a week we decided to upgrade to the Captain's Cabin, which still was smaller than a normal size hotel room. To be honest, to some this hotel was probably ok for them, for us it wasn't, so half way through the day we decided that we needed to change hotels. Our boss, called The Jane and spoke with the manager who then told her that we can cancel our reservations and that we would only have to pay for half the day since we only had our bags there from 6am to 4pm (same day). We get back to the hotel after being gone, got our bags and checked out only to talk with the manager and he wanted to charge us for a day and a half!!!!! He was NOT willing to work with us but decided to settle with us paying a day's rate because we checked in early, mind you the man in the morning told us it was FREE for us to check in early. The manager was not helpful, charged us more than what he told our boss that he would charge us, the hotel was eerie and dark and the smell was horrible. I would NOT recommend staying here to anyone. Had the manager been more helpful then we would have left and that would have been it because he wasn't I am writing this review so people know.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Jane!”
Reviews.Author: Preeek
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Jane every time I travel to New York - which is easily twice a month. The bang for the buck is amazing - the staff if the most helpful, kind hotel staff I've ever had, the bar is great when you feel like having a New York night without having to make your way out and the restaurant has some of the best snack foods and hippest atmospheres I've come across in a hotel of The Jane's type. Highly recommend The Jane for anyone traveling alone, who wants to stay in a cool, safe area of Manhattan. Only downside is if you're two and you stay in the bunk room - it's a very very tight squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Totally french chic,very NYC,comfortable,the place to eat and play. Kudos!”
Reviews.Author: 1peripatetictraveler
Reviews.Content: Me, myself and I went for a quick theater jaunt to Greenwich Village first of this year. The Jane kept popping up. The moment I arrived I had a smile on my face. The employees dressed in vintage French hotel uniforms were polite and efficient. I chose the single berth room for $79.00. ($99 ttl. Unheard of in Manhattan) Funky as can be.I am 6'2 228 lbs and the small room 50sq ft was just as they described and pictured it on website. Comfortable bed similar to a Murphy bed. Shared bathrooms immaculate. Again as described and pictured on website. Checked out the captains quarters 250 sq ft king or queen for $250 was perfect. The room I saw was nicer than the one pictured. Cafe Gitane, so French chic, food four star and the staff fantastic once again. The Ballroom Bar is the Place to be. When making reservations it would be wise to request a room away from the Ballroom Bar. Gets loud. Party on.

Reviews.Title: “My home from home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JamesPhillipsUK
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I visit New York - which is often, as I love the city. New York is an expensive city. In other cities you might get a larger room for the price you pay at the Jane, but in New York, hotels don't come cheap. So, yes the rooms are tiny, and you have to share a bathroom, but if like me you just want a place to sleep and want to spend your money on your waking activities, the rooms are perfectly comfortable and clean, as are the bathrooms. What's more, the hotel has so much charm and history, and the staff are outstandingly friendly and helpful. These factors set it way above other budget options. Also, the neighbourhood is great. On one trip, I was generously upgraded to a captain's cabin on my last night, so I can report that these rooms, with ensuite bathrooms, are just lovely if you're happy to spend more typical New York room rates for extra comfort. I was sad to read on here that the original manned elevator is being replaced by a new unmanned one. Perhaps, this was a necessary improvement, but the manned elevator was one of the real charms of the place for me. I'm staying again in May 2011, and recommend this place to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of charm and atmosphere in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jansson-Olsson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double overlooking the Hudson. The room was small but romantic and beautifully decorated with old-fashoned wallpaper and furniture. The bathroom was newly renovated with turn of the century features but still comfortable. The only problems with our room was the heat (too warm) and the lack of a mini bar. The location is excellent! Especially for all the restaurants and bars in the Meatpacking district but it's also whithin walking distance of the Village. This is truly a hotel with history and a style of itÂ´s own and you won't find many like it! The rooms are perhaps not as comfortable as in other hotels within the same price-range but if You value personality and atmosphere the Jane is an excellent choice! The cafÃ© and the stunning bar are also nice features, especially since the rooms are quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs in the shower!!!”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews for this hotel on Trip Advisor and considering the price of the room ($79 per night + tax) I though even worse case scenario its going to be livable! Right? WRONG! First night = no sleep and then had to move rooms at 3am because the noise from the bar was so loud, I was on the 3rd floor. Moved to the 6th floor - no elevator (which I knew about in advance). I was told that the club closed at 4am so the noise wouldn't be a problem after that.... fantastic. So the noise is only until 4am.... they should have said earlier and I would have waited to go to sleep!!! So then I moved rooms, the room was what I expected, however the bed was way too small... the bed in the first room was ok but the second room it was literally about 2ft wide and about 5ft long! Not good... The whole place just had a 'sticky' feel to it, like it wasn't clean... I know thats part of the vintage appeal but it wasn't great to walk around bare foot! The final straw came when I was taking a shower on the sixth day and the whole ceiling was covered in flies, tiny little fruit flies..... I checked out that day! <<<<<<<<<<Just a little bit on Bed Bugs>>>>>>>>> (during my stay there were always 2 people outside the hotel handing out fliers for Bed Bugs and claiming that the Jane had been infested for months and the management didn't know how to deal with them... ok so I spoke to the hotel and they explained that they were a rival company from the company they used when they did have bed bugs and they were basically wanting payback for not getting the contract.... thats understandable but in the process of explaining who they were the hotel clearly admitted that there had been a problem with bed bugs in the past)

Reviews.Title: “Feel uber chic & afford it”
Reviews.Author: TraverseLaRue
Reviews.Content: I'm mad about this place. I'll recommend it to all friends & family who visit NYC. The rooms are not huge (tho most of the glam hotels have small rooms) but so many luxury touches. Bigelow lotion. Slippers & a robe. Flat screen tv. Cafe Gitane downstairs offers very yummy food with a number of Veggie options. Service in the hotel is attentive. Plus the hotel is a few blocks from the Highland. I never write reviews. Many for this hotel were positive but I still had to add my voice. It was recommended by a friend who's taste I respect & who is pickier than me.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in the Whole World”
Reviews.Author: aaronusa
Reviews.Content: After staying at The Jane twice I have now decided that it is my favorite hotel anywhere. Not just in New York City, but in the whole world. The reason is that The Jane me to stay in New York City, my favorite city, in a modicum of luxury without spending thousands of dollars for a week in the city. Sure, if someone else were paying for my stay or I had all the money in the world I would probably stay at one of the other great hotels in the area, like the Standard or the Gansevoort, or possibly a classic mid-town hotel. But for visiting New York on my own dime I am a Jane devotee. I need three things when I visit NYC: 1) a good location 2) a reliable and preferably free Internet connection 4) cleanliness. The Jane provides all four. It's about a three minute walk from the trendy Meanpacking District restaurants, where I can justify a breakfast at Pastis with all the money I've saved staying at The Jane. Wireless Internet is free and fast and doesn't require a password. The rooms are spotlessly clean, and the shared bathroom for the cheapest rooms are likewise. On this trip, I spent the first night staying at a cheap hotel in Chinatown where I felt depressed and miserable every minute I was there. The next three nights I stayed at The Jane, which was actually less expensive but left me feeling like a million bucks. I've read some of the negative reviews on The Jane, and many strike me as a bit ridiculous. Yes, the rooms are too small for two people - the beds are three feet wide. And I can understand how some people would be bothered by a shared bathroom, even though it's impeccably clean and the stalls are totally private. The Jane is not the perfect hotel for everyone in every situation. But it's perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously loved this place, one of my favorites for sure.”
Reviews.Author: MBakerPhoto
Reviews.Content: I'm a small person, and was a solo traveler, so I didn't need a lot of space. What I did need was to save money. As a huge interior design and history buff (and also a historical preservationist) I adored this hotel. I had traveled to nYC once before and stayed at a chain and honestly, I hated that trip. I hated the whole city! This recent trip made me totally change my mind, and I think the Jane had something to do with it. The rooms are ADORABLE! Everyone I encountered who worked there was amazing and nice. The only con is something that was already mentioned...it was too freaking hot! I had the window open the whole time and although it could get a little noisy, it's the most crowded city in the US, what do you expect? Loved this hotel. They are doing it right. It's cute, they give you what you need, and it's affordable. I hope they dont change anything, except maybe the way they heat the place. I'll def be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: TiaPineo
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helpful with everything you ask them. The bedrooms are small but clean. The shared bathroom is also very clean. I felt very comfortable the 4 days I stayed at The Jane. Its located in Greenwich, next to the Hudson River and you can also see the Statue of Liberty from this side. The subway is only in a 5 minutes walking distance at the corner 8th Ave/14st Street.

Reviews.Title: “This Time- Winter Experience!”
Reviews.Author: OXMINSTER
Reviews.Content: After experiencing The Jane last August, with it's pros and 'Heads-Up!', I returned for the Xmas season. PROS: Once again, the facilities are lovely; rooms cozy; staff pleasant. HEADS-UP: We were on the fifth floor this time, ...yet the noise from the bar/lounge, 5 floors down, could be heard throughout the night. Furthermore, upon returning to the hotel for the evening around 10ish, we fancied a drink in the "bar/lounge of our hotel." We were denied and told that there was a "private function." Wha? on a Saturday night?? So EARLY in the evening??? This is NEW YORK, where I've recently lived for the past 3 years, ....""""Private Functions"""" for """kool people""" don't start until well after MIDNIGHT!!!!!! (Being told you can't experience the Bar/Lounge of your OWN hotel is a bit off-putting!). Lastly, if you desire peace and quiet, request a room on the interior of the building. Rooms that face Jane Street, such as (roughly) odd number rooms (Floors -1)(-2)(-3)(-4)(-533-549) [we were in 543A] face Jane Street AND 'highway-esque' West St (along the river), are noisy because the A/C unit acts as a quasi 'hole' in the window, as if the window is open, and all the traffic noise just pours right through. I'm 30-something, ....maybe 20-somethings can sleep through anything, like I remember I used to! Other than that on this winter's experience, novel place! Come all, but just prepare!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Johnnytheswede
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend was staying four nights at The Jane and it was mostly awesome. Alright, it's a bit noisy but being in a big city as New York is and considering the price I really can't complain. The AC unit however is awful, it was very loud and as several said before me it is necessary to have it running even though it's minus celsius outside. That is also the only thing I really can complain about. But if you are walking around in NYC for a whole day even a noisy AC unit can't hold you back sleeping! Food was great in the cool french cafe downstairs. Staff was kind and helpful. Location was awesome, we didn't take a cab for any of the attractions NYC had to offer. I read you guys was planning to replace the old elevator you have. That's a shame since that was probably the coolest thing ever in my hotel life! Dude that was working when we were there was the best ever! Happy holidays dudes and dudettes! If I ever get back to New York I'll book a room at your place straight away!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: WandererLondon
Reviews.Content: My first impression was that the hotel was so much more impressive than I had expected, great location on a lovely cobbled street, a stunning lobby and very friendly and helpful staff. The room was as described, small but functional. Some nice touches: the bathrobes, slippers and complimentary water was appreciated. The bathrooms were small but clean. There was only 1 hook in the shower to hang any clothes, towel etc, a bit more space to put items/get changed would have been great. The big issue came at night: the walls were paper thin and I could hear everything happening outside my room: doors slamming, people snoring, shouting in the corridor. I 'm by no means a light sleeper but was unable to get any sleep. The room was also extremely hot, even with the window left open. I won't be back because of the noise, a real shame as otherwise I loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little "jewel" down by the Hudson”
Reviews.Author: Renee-traveler
Reviews.Content: I loved this place---even though standing in the middle of the room, I could actually touch the walls on both sides of the room! it's small, but it had all I needed---and was only $99---I enjoyed walking on the Hudson River and the new High Line Park---it's right by it! Staff excellent, friendly, helpful--restaurant EXCELLENT food! and great atmosphere---don't know about the larger rooms, but mine was small but adequate---charming building--just really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, well located hostel type hotel, with loads of charm and quirkiness”
Reviews.Author: dasberliner
Reviews.Content: At first my review was going to be negative for this hotel but it did warm on me after a few days, I stayed for 4, and at $100 USD a nite, this was the driving force behind my choice of the Jane. The hotel is located in the north village (Greenwich) and a stoneâ€™s throw from Chelsea, the area as you would imagine is quite trendy and upmarket, with lots of New York town home type buildings, people walking dogs, and cute little cafes selling cream cheese bagels, which no doubt have been doing this for years. The lobby is old fashioned and yes the staff wear cruise outfits from the early 20th century, you can walk to you room via the stairs or wait for the bell man to take you up in the old lift, which they operate manually. I understand this is being replaced in the new year with a new one. I stayed in a single cabin room which was the size of a king size bed, but functional, it had a day bed single, with storage underneath, and above, plus drawers built in, with a safe in the draw. LCD TV and Ipod dock were also supplied, and room had AC and a fan, which strangely enough you need as the heating has the room at well into the 80's (30 degrees Celsius plus) and you canâ€™t control the heat! I slept with the fan, AC and window open despite the winter temps outside. The shared bathrooms are located on the floors, and were clean and usually free to use. The downside is there is a nightclub at the hotel on weekends so donâ€™t expect much sleep, couple this with noisy air conditioners running thru the nite, leaves me to give the hotel and overall ok, with sleep quality being the major downfall. The above aside, a good choice of hotel for the young traveller with a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel with history”
Reviews.Author: redskye72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jane for four days at the tail end of Thanksgiving week. Staff went out of their way to help and even the elevator (which I had heard so much about) had no problems to which I was grateful (and being on the 6th floor that elevator was a lifesaver). My only real issue out of my entire stay was the sound of the heating system which when turned on sounded like a loud woosh coming through the room which woke me up early every morning. From what I was told this is the sound of steam at high pressure coming through the pipes and with the hotel having been built in 1906 this was understandable. Old hotel, has a lot of character, it makes sounds and if you are expecting silence when you come to NYC you choose the wrong place. The Jane sits on a lovely little cobblestone street in the greenwich village and the west side highway, and the neighborhood itself is charming and near the Skyline. Having grown up on a sailboat the size of my room didn't faze me, but if you are expecting to spread out in a basic bunk cabin think again. The room itself was fine for one, and suited my basic needs. I ran around NY most of the time I was there, and came back to the Jane in the evenings to rest up. On the first floor of the hotel is a little french cafe that has the most wonderful waffles. The orange waffle was amazing and I had it twice during my stay. But if the cafe is not for you, there's a shop one block over which is reasonable and has a hot bar so you can pick and choose your food. Also on the first floor or basement (couldn't really tell) is a ballroom which is a lively club. But I didn't have much to do with it, other than having a laugh sitting in the lobby early one morning waiting for my ride watching some rather pretentious (and some drunk) NY'ers getting turned down by the formidable looking bouncer "for not being on the list". It was hilarious to watch to be honest. All in all I'd stay at the Jane again, it's reasonable, the walk to the subway at 14th and 8th really isn't that far and you not only get a feel of old NY but a bit of Titanic history too.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for purpose”
Reviews.Author: bettedavisstyle
Reviews.Content: as a female solo traveler, i never felt unsafe in the neighborhood. i found the room comfy and clean and very pretty. i wrote letters in the cafe and was a little sad when i left. i just booked my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for solo travelers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: neal990
Reviews.Content: I booked a short trip to NYC on a whim and needed somewhere cheap to stay in Manhattan and came across The Jane. I was nervous about the bathrooms being shared but they were immaculately clean and I never had to wait for a shower or the toilet. The rooms are as small as advertised, but there was still plenty of storage space for my luggage. If you're the type of person who needs alot of bells and whistles in your room or who plans on spending alot of time in the room, this is not the place for you. The rooms were comfortable, and the flatscreen tv, wall outlets, and free wifi were nice. But really you should only stay at the Jane if you view your hotel room just as a place to lay your head. With the cheap rates and incredible location, this is perfect for travelers looking for a place they can drop their bags, explore the city, come back for sleep, and then head back out again. Can't wait to try it again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Jane Hotel - historic & quirky on a budget - great value”
Reviews.Author: retro_rucksack
Reviews.Content: From the interesting website to the period-style porters hats, the Jane has lived up to my expectations. I'm a keen student of Titanic trivia and was excited to see the Jane hosted her survivors. The sense of history prevails at the Jane and it is appointed with a great eye for detail. The rooms are small as advertised, but compact and provide ample storage. Wifi works well and the TV and steady supply of water bottles a welcome addition. To get a basic robe and slippers for th price is excellent value; feels less like a hostel and more like a boutique hotel. The bathrooms are neat and clean and I never had to wait for a shower. It appears that several residents live here but they move through the halls quietly and the whole place is dimly lit and retains its former elegance. The staff are awesome and friendly and the cafe and bar downstairs charming and very atmospheric; again, the decor is fantastic. My friend and I opted for separate rooms and were glad for it, but we are super-shoppers and had loads of excess goodies. I guess two people could share but the price of a single room is so cheap I'd recommend it. We still spent the short times we were in the hotel in each others rooms anyway! The location is superb; close to delis and the High Line Park, as well as the river, and its a short walk from the subway. All very convenient. I really enjoyed my experience at the Jane Hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, good location, but watch out for the priorities!”
Reviews.Author: JonchikandChristophe
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Jane was part of a 5 month trip through the Americas - part of a sabbatical from work. The place is a novelty for sure. The rooms have a narrow spare to operate in so you need to be tidy if there are two of you. You will bump, bounce and scratch on the fixtures and fittings. But its ok and the location is great. Collecting water from the lift (elevator) is strange but ok. The place models itself on being quirky and cool. The latter is its downfall. Every night, bar the last night of our stay, I heard the music and felt the vibrations from the ballroom - where hte whos who of NYC seem to hang out. It is very cool, but when you're in NY for 5 days and want to be out and about in the morning you should consider the impact of this on your following day. Lets just say getting to a spacious christian womens hostel in Boston was a relief ... surprising for us too! However, Sunday night the Ballroom is closed so no staying awake til 3-4am ... one night you can sleep. i must say, however, the management responded to my complaint and offered the possibility of moving to a quiet room. We had when booking requested a quiet room and being on the 3rd floor assumed it would be. All in all its fine, cool, quirky but ought to make the guests a priority rather than the club nights. One night we were told to move off the steps by two bouncers - we said we were staying at the hotel, but were told to move! Priorities in place and this place is very good for location, price etc in NYC but be tidy!

Reviews.Title: “High-end rooms are poor value.”
Reviews.Author: MacGlockenditch
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a quirky hotel for a business trip and booked one of the Jane's high end rooms (Captain's Quarters I think they're called). The room was about $295/night without tax. My first room was on a low floor and close to the nightclub below which I could hear pretty clearly until 3am on a midweek night. After complaining, I was moved to a higher room with a tiny window and very noisy AC. So basically, I couldn't get a good night's sleep. The hotel is quirky, but in my opinion very shabby/dirty, the staff are fine, but well below par for NYC. For the same money, and a little haggling, you can stay at the Soho Grand, which is a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Miniscule rooms with shared bath and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ingmar53
Reviews.Content: The very cool website doesn't hide the fact that the rooms are tiny; the building is the former 1908 American Seaman's Friend Society Sailors' Home and Institute, and the rooms are like sailors' cabins. When I say small, I'm talking 4'X7' max... just enough room for a smaller-than-usual single bed and space to enter. Nevertheless, it's well-designed with a few drawers and space to stash a piece of luggage below the bed and a shelf above the bed (in single rooms) to get other things out of the way. The historic wood paneling adds character, and a wall-size mirror adorns the wall opposite the bed so things aren't too claustrophobic. There is a window, but don't expect much of a view. There is a small flat-screen-TV (it would have to be small and flat!) and the ceiling and reading lights as well as a small fan for air circulation are rheostat-controlled directly above the bed. There is also separately controlled air-conditioning, although I didn't need it in November. The double rooms have bunk-beds in place of the single bed (which I WOULD find claustrophobic), and there are a handful of double-bed rooms with en-suite bathrooms for twice the cost of the majority shared-bath rooms... still a bargain. The basic single rate is $99 before all the NYC taxes... which has to be the best deal in town. Using the standard hotel search engines, I could not find anything else for under $300/night for a popular weekend in any Manhattan location. The compact lobby retains the high ceilings and dark wood paneling of its early days with a wonderfully original elevator that requires an operator. Other amenities include telephone with voice-mail, alarm clock/iPod dock, FREE WIFI and complimentary bicycles! The trendy Cafe Gitane is off the lobby, which I'm told has the best breakfast in town. The shared baths are clean and shiny with black and white tile, but cramped--including one marble sink, two toilet stalls and a one-person shower room. The downside of the shower is that it requires you to hang your towel and whatever you wear to the shower WITHIN the small room, making it very difficult to keep anything dry. They provide tiny bathrobes and disposable slippers, but the bathrobe provided would fit only the tiniest adult I can imagine. (My bathrobe did not extend below my waist!) The most annoying negative of the Jane is the constant sound of closing doors throughout the night (which others have mentioned here), making a sound sleep difficult--unless you can sleep comfortably with ear-plugs... which you MAY have remembered to bring along. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful--something not all that common in Manhattan, especially at a bargain-rate hotel. Desk staff and porters wear period uniforms with classic pill-box hats, and maids have period costumes as well--actually a nice reinforcement of the historic character of the place. Initially I was skeptical of the location--at the end of Jane Street just this side of the West Side Highway and the river. But it's near the trendy nightlife of the meat-packing district--not of great interest to me, to be honest, but also a short 5-block walk to the 14th Street subway hub, where you can easily reach other parts of the city. I heartily recommend this place... if you are young and desperate for an affordable hotel in NYC. I'm NOT so young and will do my best to pay a little more for more comfort next time. Maybe I'll try one of those rare double rooms with en suite at the Jane!

Reviews.Title: “Top location, nicest staff ever, great value”
Reviews.Author: karlalopez
Reviews.Content: DidnÂ´t have to wait for bathroom not even once. Everything was clean. Staff is great, very polite and willing to help. The weird thing is that it seems to have a few strange people actually living there. IÂ´m not sure about but IÂ´m guessing because these people were in bedrooms with different locks and they really act like theyÂ´re living there for a while. Anyway, it wasn't something that made me feel uncomfortable or anything. I really enjoyed. I would stay there again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a top location”
Reviews.Author: Tink02
Reviews.Content: A little gem in the funky meatpacking district. Room was tiny (as advertised) but clean with fresh linen each day. Service was excellent and staff were very helpful at all times. Bathrooms were easily accessible and relatively clean. It was however noisy - at night you could constantly hear doors opening and closing - I'd recommend ear plugs. Great cafe and bar. I'd definitely recommend it for the price and location if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The Jane is for serious sightseers who spend their stay out-and-about, not hanging out in their room or the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: ElAltodeSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I'd been prepared for The Jane. A friend had stayed and tipped me off to the compact quarters and shared baths. But I was up for an adventure, and the oh-so-trendy MPD (Meat Packing District) promised treats in addition to the hotel. Some will judge The Jane quirky. For me, it was perfect. The staff was super-friendly, the service -- an elevator operator, how cool is that! -- was attentive, and the amenities (FREE Wi-Fi, DVD, iPod docking, plus complementary robe for those strolls to the shared shower) were better than I expected. Add to these positives Cafe Gitane, which serves up the best breakfast in Manhattan in a French bistro setting that complements the cuisine perfectly, and The Jane is a FIND worth every dollar of the $99/night I paid for a five-night stay. Did I mention how terrific The Jane is?

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms Yet Excellent Service and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: QuirkyKitschGirl
Reviews.Content: Indeed, the rooms are tiny and bathrooms are shared yet, who spends all day in a hotel room in New York? This was also great on my business budget. Rooms and shared bathrooms were spotless - cleaner than most hotels I've stayed at recently. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Loved the retro bellhop and housekeeper uniforms. The place is a bit quirky, look for the monkey behind the front desk. Bed was a bit stiff but towels, robe and slippers were soft. On site restaurant is eclectic with a Bohemian vibe and serves delish meals - try the salmon pie - yum! Great location and although near subway stops, I chose to walk to Midtown daily. Things of note: dance party USA seemed to rock on at midnight or so, walls aren't thick and I could hear music coming from somewhere at a time when I should've been sleeping.
