The only gripe we had was that the bar in the hotel was closed to residents practically every night we stayed for "a Private Party". There is a small pub like bar and a larger ballroom bar next door and these were off limits to guests when it was hired out and it was guest list only We were told that whilst the bar is IN the Jane Hotel, its privately owned and rented out regularly to whomever and the hotel has not much say in the matter. But the Jane is in a great area for plenty of other pubs/bars/resturants anyway all within a short stroll so it wasn't a problem. Plus the one night we DID get in the bar, the drinks were $12 dollars each!! And that was for a meagre glass of wine. So my advice go somewhere else for a tipple as IMO the owner of the Jane Bar must be a bit pretentious to charge those prices in a budget hotel. There is a Cafe/Coffee shop opening soon in the lobby area which looks to be good so that be a alternative to the bar. In the meantime the nearest deli Nonno Gourmet does loads of hot food, bagels, coffee to take out and if you walk North towards 14th St and 9th Av in the Meatpacking area there is a really cool diner that does fabulous breakfasts! The area itself is great and if you are relatively fit, you can easily walk southwards towards Downtown/Wall Street via Washington St or North towards Midtown (or get on subway at 14th St) We walked everywhere and the West Village is my favourite part of New York. Hudson St, Bleeker St are all close by and have a great choice of food places to eat. Oh and one last thing, if you are new to New York like me and didn't realise prices didn't include taxes, the Jane's $99 per night DOES NOT include taxes. Its not shown on your confirmation invoice either so don't get caught out. All in all plus taxes its approx $117 dollars per night. If I was to go back again, I would happily stay there again, with friends or on my own. I recommend New York (fell in love with the place) and I recommend the Jane experience. It's not the Hilton or anything posh but its quirky and unusual and definately a talking point but in a good way... Thanks for a pleasant stay and I hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what I wanted.”
Reviews.Author: Charlotta8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Jane for 4 nights in September and loved it. The tiny room was indeed tiny but as a first timer in NY this wasn't a problem, I was traveling alone and only looking for a place to sleep/wash/relax. The shared bathroom was clean my entire trip, not a single bed bug (I checked), the staff were really helpful and friendly, the other guests an eccentric mix of people like me and the long term residents who are still in situ. Some people have complained about the location, it's not easily accessible by subway but it took me a mere 20 minutes to walk to 5th Avenue and NY taxis are cheap for night time travel. At $99 a night +tax for Manhattan I really couldn't complain but this is not a hotel for people accustomed to luxury or Hilton type hotels. It's quirky in the best possible way and I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “If all you want is a cheap bed...”
Reviews.Author: miss_cg
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews on The Jane before I went to stay there, so I knew what to expect. I was concerned about bed bugs after reading some reviews, but had no problems with that at all. The bathrooms were very clean, however we stayed there for 4 nights and nobody ever cleaned our room or replaced the bottle of water you are given upon arrival. The noise from the bar downstairs (or rather the people leaving it) is pretty annoying, we actually turned on the airconditioner to drown out that noise. We stayed in a bunk room and from the photos expected it to be small, but no photo can do it justice. Be prepared to perfect the dance of stepping out of the room so the other person can open their suitcase or walk past you. I had the same problem as someone else- when giving a credit card guarantee, they took $100/night from my credit card without informing me for security, which is ridiculous considering the room barely cost that per night. Quite embarrassing also when I tried to make a purchase elsewhere and it was declined, not to mention the $20 phone I made to my bank in Australia to find out what had happened. The area was lovely though and the staff were good once you got used to their inflated hipster-ness :) For the price, I'd definitely stay there again. Just make sure that you budget an extra $100 per night for the security "deposit" from your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Short-Term Stay”
Reviews.Author: room317
Reviews.Content: The Jane provides excellent value for the price. I stayed for a week on business, and would likely recommend this hotel to budget travelers. High points: Charming historic building, an old elevator run by an operator, clean bathrooms. The small rooms are smartly designed, with shelves, overhead storage, drawers under the bed, hooks on the door, and several sliding hooks on each side of the room from which to hang clothing or towels. High speed internet was reliable and fast. My room was well-cleaned upon arrival. Things to be aware of: *The bathrooms, while clean, are truly shared. In other words, it is not one stand-alone bathroom that you enter and have to yourself, as it is in some hotels with shared bathrooms. The bathroom on my floor had two sinks, two shower stalls (with full-length doors) and two toilet stalls (with full length doors as well). If you are not comfortable using the toilets, sinks/mirrors, or entering/exiting the shower with others in the room - including those of the opposite sex - this may be an issue for you. *The hotel provides a set of disposable flip-flops, but mine both broke on my very first trip to the bathroom. You may wish to bring footwear of your own. *Shampoo, shower gel, and conditioner are provided in the showers from pumps. Bath towels and hand towels were provided, but not washcloths. You may wish to bring your own washcloth and/or shower poof. *Tissues were not provided in the rooms or the bathrooms. *The permanent residents of the building - mostly older, downtrodden types - may seem intimidating at first but I never encountered a problem. * The rooms are truly small. They are actually smaller than they look in the photos, so be prepared. * It's a bit of a walk to the subway station (about 6 minutes) and cabs don't pass the hotel as frequently as on other streets, so you may find yourself walking over to the next block to hail one. This, combined with the flight of stairs you need to ascend to enter the front door, makes this hotel less suitable for people with limited mobility or with large amounts of luggage. I sense that the management, possibly in part because of the location, wants to make the place a hip, trendy, boutique hotel of sorts. I hope this doesn't distract them from continuing to strive for what most travelers are really looking for: clean, safe, well-appointed rooms that are also affordable. Another reviewer's comment about the "hipper-than-thou" young desk clerk also suggest the hotel's inclination toward the trendy ambiance. But really, how hip can you be wearing a bellboy's hat?

Reviews.Title: “Five nights at The Jane”
Reviews.Author: MissL123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Jane from 10 to 15 Sept 09. My first time in NY, though I am well travelled, and with a little trepidation after reading the mixed reviews on this site. My first room was 410 a corner room and though I expected the room to be small this was just teeny tiny. I am only 5 foot 5 and my feet hung over the end of the bed. It was also a bit noisy next to the stairwell door. When I explained my predicament to the extremely helpful staff (and extremely helpful throughout my 5 day stay) , I was moved to another room, 417. And they very kindly moved my luggage for me so I did not have to come back during the day to swap. I am very, very fussy when it comes to cleanliness - the bathrooms were always very clean and I never had to queue. My bedroom was clean and I had fresh towels. One day I'd not been left any so requested some - promptly given. Water - you only had to ask for it to be refilled. Crappy jandals - yes - but I just wore my own flip flops/jandals to the shower. There is a pretty awful smell in the corridors (on the 4th floor) anyway, which is quite overwhelming at times, and I'm not sure what they can do about it while the hotel is still shared with permanent residence. The smell does not pervade the rooms though and yes, the aircon was noisy, but fine for a quick blast to cool things down before sleeping. For $100 a night in such a fantastic area, really friendly and helpful staff I would recommend The Jane and describe it for now, as a posh hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: pinang
Reviews.Content: Everything was ok. Staff was helpful, room and bathroom were clean. Great location. It was the cheapest available hotel in Manhattan at that time. But it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Key or no key”
Reviews.Author: jas044
Reviews.Content: I actually enjoyed most of my stay at the Jane...liked the room (549) and its proximity to the bathroom but had a serious issue at the end of my stay. The hotel uses a funky key system that involves an electronic key and a metal rod that turns on all of the power except for an overhead light that works all the time. I had the option of lugging it around with me or dropping it off at the desk and picking up a new one on my way back in. I picked the latter option. Everything was fine and dandy until I came back late Thursday night/Friday morning to find that there were no keys left. The man at the front desk looked high and low for one but ended up having to let me in the room with his master key. However, no rod, which meant no electricity other than the overhead light. Since I was leaving within hours anyway, it wasn't a huge deal, but it did put a damper on an otherwise pleasant stay. I did contact the hotel and was told that there's a stash of keys that the front desk guy apparently didn't know about. In spite of the key mess, I would definitely consider staying again. However, I might just hold on to the first key they give me...which in turn could cause potential problems for someone else.:)

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS IN ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: malcantara
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a friend of mine, date of check-in was 9.9.09 - separate rooms. It started out just fine until we tried to sleep after both having very long flights. The newly opened hotel bar really should be called a club AND it really should not be in this hotel. It kept both of us awake at all hours of the night. Remember that NYC bars don't shut down until about 4am. When we complained to the front desk, he tried to give us the excuse that all the rooms are soundproof. Nice try, but I don't think so. The bags under my eyes are proof. My friend has her own handful of complaints with this place - they didn't stock her room with clean towels and they didn't clean her room until we specifically asked and requested them to do so. This is probably the reason why when I woke up on one of the many nights I could not sleep : 3:30am : I found a bedbug crawling out from under my pillow. Not having ever seen a bedbug, I killed it immediately, then called the front desk to let them know. They immediately said they would find a room for me and call me back. After waiting for a bit, I looked back to my bed to find yet another bug crawling on the bed. This is where I took my clothes and bag and got the hell out of there. It was the most disturbing thing to me that I had been sleeping in the same room with bedbugs. They switched me to another room and though I didn't experience another bug in the new room, I woke up with bites by the time I was checking out. I'll be requesting a refund on this soon. Hope you have better luck! p.s. I almost forgot the best part. While trying to purchase a pair of shoes in NY, my debit card was declined. When I called my bank, they informed me that there was an $800 + charge from The Jane hotel in NYC. Now we were only staying there 4 nights so this was a surprise. My first thought was that they had charged me twice for my stay there. When I called to speak to the front desk, they were very rude and let me know that they "hold" 4 nights of the hotel on the card and that's what the charge was for. So, basically, they had charged me for all 4 nights of my stay upon check-in, didn't let me know, and completely depleted my checking account. They tried to tell me that it was in the contract that I had signed, but they didn't bother to point out that very important fact. This is the first place I've ever stayed where they charge you upon arrival. Again, good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great value”
Reviews.Author: CJHFla
Reviews.Content: Ok, here is the scoop on the Jane. I loved the location, West Village. The rooms are very small but the shared bath is always clean. There are some locals that live there and that is a bit odd, but they dont bother you. The club is VERY popular and at night trying to get into the one entrance shared with the club is not easy, Basically have to beg the bouncers to get by. Huge crowds outside trying to get in. Id stay again, the price is great. Staff is nice

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good NYC hotel, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: bcbc23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days, on the 5th floor, room 542, after reading about it's renovation in New York Magazine. Great location in the West Village, not far from the now infamous High Line Park, and right on the Hudson River. New York was super hot that week, and I took three showers a day, and the shared bathrooms were spotless 95% of the time. (I loved gazing at the Statue of Liberty each morning as I brushed my teeth!) Good extras: Flat screen TV with DVD, ipod docks, air conditioning. Great staff! Rooms and beds very tiny; similar to all the small hotels I've stayed in in Europe. I didn't experience any bugs, and had minimal conact with postitutes/johns and 'odd' permnament residents, but also met nice European and American guests, too. Hotel is a little haunted; it's over a hundred years old, and sheltered Titanic survivors, after all, and I saw a few ghosts (!) The Jane is very much like New York City itself, fascinating beyond belief, and unforgettable. Nice story about The Jane in the newest Paper magazine, too.

Reviews.Title: “A Good and Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: gervaise77
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives: Staff is extremely friendly and will go out of their way to make your experience comfortable. As soon as we arrived, we were early for check-in and they were willing to store out bags for free until our check-in time of 3:00pm. The Lobby is extremely nice with a bar that seems to attract a huge line every night. The rooms were clean with an LCD screen on both the top and bottom bunk. Every room comes with AC, an IPOD dock. Although the rooms were extremely small, it provides a nice and safe place to crash ( who would want to stay in their hotel room when they are in NY). Bathrooms were also surprisingly clean. The cleaners do a good job in that regard. Location is also very convenient, only a few blocks from the nearest subway station and several classy restaurants. Very very safe area. A little far from the main attractions ( Times Square, Central Park) however, is walkable (if you're young). Negatives: - Although the rooms are clean, the hallway is disgusting. The Jane is shared with hotel and local residents. Therefore as you walk towards your room, each room breathes out a unique smell (mostly bad). There are also very poor people who live in the Jane who don't seem to have AC and leave their doors slightly open which leaves out a horrible smell. THere is also a resident who leaves his door open and just stares at people who walk past. Quite freaky but I'm sure he means no harm. Also came across roaches in our room a couple of times. Recently the hallway literally smelled like fresh feces which refuses to go away. The rooms are extremely small, enough to do a 360 on the spot. Our rooms were also missing the complimentary water as well as the " do not disturb sign". This place is not the newest nor the cleanest place but you can tell that the management is doing its best to make it a classy hotel. I wouldn't recommend it for the faint hearted. For the price I paid, I am pretty unsatisfied with my overall experience mainly because of the unhygienic conditions . I'd give this place five or so more years to develop and maybe I'd come back. Negatives:

Reviews.Title: “Microhotel w/ tons of charm & value in the best of locations”
Reviews.Author: Chrizninja
Reviews.Content: Really, what more could you ask for in NYC for less than $90 a night? Yes, the rooms may be tiny but that is honestly the only "negative" about this place. staff is super helpful, give you new bottles of water each day, its located a stones throw from the Hudson, tons of cabs readily available a block away, subway access 5 minutes away, FREE WIFI that works great, NICE LCD TV, and more importantly, CLEAN CLEAN shared bathrooms. never had to wait for a shower or toilet. make sure to check out the Ballroom bar. I will be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for travelers who need a nice safe place to sleep and that's it”
Reviews.Author: christopher024
Reviews.Content: I came to NYC for 4 days to see my girlfriend, so I wasn't going to be spending much time in my room. I've always been opposed to the idea of spending a trip in a big expensive hotel room watching TV, so I looked around and found the Jane. Rather than other dorm-style hostels, I wanted a private room with a BED TO SLEEP IN DURING THE NIGHT AND THAT WAS IT. And that is exactly what the charming Jane Hotel provided. My room was small (only 50 square feet) but was by NO MEANS CRAMPED FOR ONE PERSON...cozy would best describe it. I would call it a hotel bedroom rather than a hotel room. The room was VERY CLEAN and surprisingly well furnished, however. Complete with AC, fan, telephone, flatscreen TV with cable, clean linens/towels, drawers, and a safe, I was very surprised upon entering the room. The pictures from the website do not lie in what the rooms look like. Down the hall was the very clean and easily accessible COMMUNAL BATHROOMS with showers. The 1908 building originally held sailors and some Titanic survivors, and still had that old-style charm. There was a nice bar and lounge area that always had some big party with live bands going on every night. I stayed during the last stages of the Jane's construction (they're adding bigger rooms on some floors and a restaurant off the lobby that are scheduled to be completed by Fall 2009) The staff was VERY VERY FRIENDLY, always offering assistance when needed and greeting you with very friendly attitudes. They made me feel like I lived there, which was something I've never felt from the cold, cookie-cutter service of big-name hotels. The Jane is in a GREAT LOCATION between the Meatpacking District and the West Village, really close to great restaurants, shopping, and transit stops. For my first time on my own in NYC, I couldn't have picked a better area to start off in. NOTE TO TRAVELERS: The Jane hotel does have permanent tenants who live in the Hotel as their home. This wasn't a problem to me one bit, I just thought it might be good to know beforehand. ALSO NOTE that due to construction some services that would be expected aren't currently available (room service, etc) AGAIN I WANT TO STATE that this is not a super-spacious luxury hotel room, it's a room with a bed. As soon as I woke up I was out seeing the great city, rather than doing nothing in my room. However, the rooms are very comfortable and offer a great refuge to relax and take a break from the hot, busy city. Overall it's a great value for New York standards (I paid 89$/night for 2 nights and 79$ the 3rd) This was the first time I traveled alone and only my second time to NYC, but my experience at the Jane will ensure my return sooner than late.

Reviews.Title: “A simple bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: Marcil1
Reviews.Content: The Jane is fine for the simple traveler who won't be spending any time in their room. The single rooms are tiny - not enough room to change your mind - but full wall mirrors make it feel twice its size. The web page ( http://www.thejanenyc.com/ ) is cute and it quite realistic. look at the room photo. It will tell you that the building has a long history as a residence. The shared bathrooms are cleaned regularly and are immaculate! Shampoo, conditioner and body wash are supplied. Lots of hot water. (No sinks in the rooms.) Air-conditioning and flat-screen TV. The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a dance club (well-frequented) on the ground floor, but I heard no noise at any time from my 3rd floor room. Apparently a restaurant will open in the fall of 2009. The neighborhood (West Village) is residential and quiet. Nearby delis and restaurants. The #11 bus (9th and 10th Ave) is a 2-minute walk. The #14 bus (14th street) a moment further, and the 8th Ave subway (at 14th) less than 10-minutes on foot. I booked by internet and was given a reasonable price. I checked several days before arriving and the web page advertised a (more recent) lower price. I phoned and they gave me the lower price without any discussion. Conclusion: a simple bed for the night, nothing more. But if that's what you are looking for, it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS, BEDBUGS, BEDBUGS.”
Reviews.Author: lagarconne
Reviews.Content: Was excited to stay at the Jane Hotel. Heard really good things and was pleased with the room, but was awoken in the middle of the night only to find that I was being eaten alive by BEDBUGS!!!!! I was so disgusted, I left my room at 4 am and Jane Hotel staff did not do ANYTHING to help the situation. I was not offered an alternate room (it would probably be infested with bedbugs as well) or compensation. I spent the rest of the evening/early morning waiting in the neighbourhood starbucks. NEVER AGAIN. Completely traumatised.

Reviews.Title: “This is a (slightly) glorified youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: string180
Reviews.Content: My bad. I should have read all of the reviews. Particularly the ones that warned of odor. I was prepared for a 50 square foot room and even prepared for the bath down the hall. I was not prepared for the dingy condition of the room, the hallway and the distinct odor of the bathroom. Depressing and sad.

Reviews.Title: “probably improvements still in progress”
Reviews.Author: Gone_There_Then
Reviews.Content: The hotel profits from an excellent location, close to subway station, close to a variety of nice bars, restaurants etc. Staff was really friendly. There is a popular club to be accessed via the lobby of the hotel, people are standing in line in front of the hotel at night ... At the moment, it seems, that no rooms are for rent in the 2nd floor. I would make sure not be attributed a room on the 2nd floor, as soon as they are renovated. As also stated by other reviewers, it is obvious, that this place serves as a rooming house still to some extent. So, on the floor, it just smells horrible from some single rooms. Bathrooms are clean, rooms too. Even if the effort to hoover at both the carpet at both ends of the bed could be increased. The rooms are very small. But there is more than enough space to accomodate your luggage. There is even a built in safe. I would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “BAR HAS TERRIBLE SERVICE. REALLY.”
Reviews.Author: hudsonnyc
Reviews.Content: Literally the worst service I have ever had. Nothing personal. Just horrible service. MODELS W NO SERVICE EXPERIENCE.

Reviews.Title: “West Village shabby chic charm”
Reviews.Author: BoroBookGirl
Reviews.Content: Great for single travellers on a tight budget who don't want to compromise on location, you're just ten minutes walk from the A, C, E and L trains at 8th Ave/14th St subway station and a tree-lined street or two from the delights of the West Village (Sex & The City's Magnolia Bakery is very near), and the designer boutiques of the Meat Packing District. The Jane has bags of West Village shabby chic charm. The rooms, or "cabins", are certainly small, but so well designed that I never felt cramped. They're very well appointed with air conditioning, fan, flat screen TV/DVD, iPod dock, safe and more than adequate storage. And with the whole of NYC waiting outside, you're not going to be spending much time awake in your room in any case. Some may baulk at the thought of using shared facilities, but this was never a problem for me. The stylish retro black and white tiled bathrooms were always very clean, and I never had to wait to use them. There was always ample hot water and great, powerful showers. The white waffle robes and slippers are a nice touch. My only minor gripes were that the cabins got very hot and stuffy, but in such a small staff the air conditioning unit was so loud as to make listening to music or watching television impossible. Also, although this is a non-smoking hotel I often smelt cigarette smoke in the hallways - this however is more of a problem with fellow guests rather than The Jane istself. All the staff were very polite, friendly and helpful. Even the old-style elevator is charming! As a lone, but independent, female traveller exploring NYC for the first time I found The Jane, although still mid-refurbishment, to be an excellent base, and I would recommend it to anyone needing a safe, secure single room in the city.

Reviews.Title: “When all you need is a clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie99
Reviews.Content: The Jane is an interesting hotel and lives up to it's micro-hotel status. The abundance of wood in the decor gives it the feel of an older ship and seems to blend in with the atmosphere of the surrounding Manhattan area. Although the rooms are about the size of a large walk-in closet and equipped with a twin size bed, they are clean, comfortable and full of storage space. A flat screen TV and DVD player is found in the room as well, along with an adequate heating/cooling system. It's definitely the kind of place to stay if you are not looking to spend a lot of time in your room and really just want a clean place to stay at a low cost. The communal bathroom is located down the hall with two showers, two sinks, and two toilets. The facilites are definitely clean and I found it no real hassle to walk down the hall to access them. The staff was exceptionally friendly and accomodating to all of my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Just what i had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: sdt74
Reviews.Content: Great value for your money. You get exactly what itÂ´s shown to you. Clean, comfortable and with very friendly and helpful staff, iÂ´d recommend it to any solo traveller out there. The location was perfect for me, a quiet, safe neighbourhood, with public transports nearby. Made my stay in NY that much more enjoyable. High five!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, First time to NYC and what a great start!”
Reviews.Author: davidtoms619
Reviews.Content: I absolutley loved this hotel for the week I was there. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room comes with a great TV, MP3 Dock/Radio and DVD player with a free bottle of spring water. Bathrooms are clean and work perfectly. The location next to the Hudson is breathtaking. Ladies and Gents, stay at this hotel. It was honestly a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for someone travelling alone”
Reviews.Author: hushti
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for someone who is travelling alone, because the rooms (the majority if not all) are for one. Great location in greenwich just below 14th street, the staff very nice, and for New York, great price. I recommend it to anyone travelling by themselves.

HotelInfo.Name: The Jane
HotelInfo.Address: 113 Jane Street, New York City, NY
